Reviews.Title: “Russian Roulette?”
Reviews.Author: Abacus763
Reviews.Content: To read some of the reviews you would think that people stayed at totally different hotels. This may in part be due to the fact that the hotel appears to be an amalgamation of at least three buildings knocked into one. I can only comment on our experience. Firstly, the room was at the top up six flights of stairs. I cannot see that anyone has mentioned that the lift only goes as far as the 1st floor, so I wouldn't wish our room on anyone unfit! However, the room itself was fine although building work is going on at this level and both our windows had scaffolding and plastic sheeting outside so not much of a view, but it was very quiet [we were at the back of the hotel, and not much actual work was taking place while we were there, mainly saturday & sunday]. The room was right under the roof with beams and I would think it could get rather hot in summer but the weather was mainly on the cool side whilst we were there so that wasn't a problem. I know from staying in another hotel in Venice a couple of years ago that it can be hot in May and some other reviewers have complained that the air-con did not work. The website states that the hotel has air con " in the summer " so when does summer start? [ As hardy Brits accustomed to a cool climate walking around in t shirts we were amused to see the locals and southern Europeans walking around in body warmers and thick coats]. Anyway, for us in cool April weather the room was comfortable, not at all pokey, it was clean, did not smell, and the bathroom was a good size with bath, shower and hot water! The double bed was comfortable and the room was extremely quiet at night so we slept very well. But the stairs did cause us to huff and puff by the time we got to the top! The hotel decor is a bit worn in places, but we were not there to assess the furnishings. We just wanted a comfotable base to explore Venice with a good location and that's what we got. As to other reviewers regative remarks: We found the reception staff [all male as others have observed] to be nothing but courteous and friendly - but then we had nothing to complain about. There were no nasty smells either in our room or common areas. I'm not a great breakfast person but it was the usual continental buffet affair with waitress service for tea/coffee etc. The tv was tiny with only BBC world news and CNN in English but who goes to Venice to watch tv? [My kids would, but we didn't take them!] Would we say there again? I think I shall explore apartments another time. In case we end up down that alley! Finally we were stung by a tourist tax as we checked out - 4 euros each per night. This could add up for a family - not sure if this applies to children as well, also since we booked our holday as an inclusive package why we had to pay it, I am checking on that.

Reviews.Title: “What a View”
Reviews.Author: delltone
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the iconic Rialto Bridge and overlooking the Grand Canal, our room at The Rialto Hotel was richly decorated in the ornate Venitian style, and the views from our windows were to die for. Our room was very large by European standards and the bed was very comfy. Sure it's a bit expensive but we figured we'd probably only visit Venice once so why not stay right on The Grand Canal and enjoy what Venice is all about. Such a unique, beautiful and romantic city, we just loved wandering (and getting lost in) the myriad of paved laneways and backstreets. The local Gelato was fantastic and of course a Gondola ride is a must. Staff at the hotel were not overly friendly and the breakfast staff were downright rude, but this all seemed to add to the charm and experience somehow for us. We shall return to Venice one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but highly overpriced..”
Reviews.Author: smitzzz
Reviews.Content: Husband and I were on a 11 days trip to Italy for our Honeymoon...for our Venice trip chose this hotel because of its location close to the Rialto bridge and St. Marks's square...and also because of the views of the Grand canal that we thought we would have from our room with a balcony as per the photos put up by the hotel..so we had booked a double room with a grand canal view and paid an obnoxious amount for it...only when we were checked in we saw that the double room was actually very tiny with tiny windows..we were put up on the 1st floor and when we opened the windows, there were no great views of the grand canal but instead were overwhelmed by street noises...we complained and then were shifted to a bigger better room on a higher floor...this room again had tiny windows and no balcony...and the views were just about decent...infact later when we stepped out we saw that the hotel had hardly any balconies..the service quality was average and there was no wifi in the room...the room as such looked old and the furnishings looked old too...the only best part was that the hotel arranged for a free taxi ride to murano on the 2nd day...but the place was located right on the rialto bridge with st marks square just a short walk away...also there was a vaporetto stop just outside the hotel and we also picked our gondola ride from here...all in all the trip was excellent but we just paid way too much for an average room in an average hotel..not recommended...

Reviews.Title: “So NOT worth the money. And no internet.”
Reviews.Author: travel9873
Reviews.Content: We were suckered into this place because yes, OK, it's right next to one of the only bridges across the Grand Canal. But it was totally not worth it. I am willing to pay $50, maybe even $100 more for a good location, but this was a totally average room, like you'd get at a midrange hotel chain in the USA, just with slightly more antique-looking furniture. The staff was extremely impolite and unhelpful, the breakfast was inelegant to say the least, and the whole experience was really off-putting. Worse, there was no internet of any kind in the rooms. We were paying almost $300 US for one room for one night (in the no-canal-view "annex"), and they made us pay an additional $8 for the internet! And it was only one login; if we wanted both computers to work, we'd have had to pay another $8. And the internet only worked in the cheesy, tiny lobby with its ugly couches and fake plants. Bleh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and service!!”
Reviews.Author: yoli1979
Reviews.Content: The Rialto Hotel is a good location in Venice. Price for the hotel was reasonable. The boat bus took us to the Rialto stop in which you walk right to the Hotel. The Rialto Hotel was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful with directions or questions. Breakfast included a variety of foods which I enjoyed with delicious coffee. There are many places to eat and shop around the area. I would definitely return back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location and view can't be beat, but room just average”
Reviews.Author: BigMommaof4
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the Rialto Bridge and canal. The furniture reminded me of French provincial with local blown glass adorning the the lamps. The bathroom wasn't the most up to date but was clean. The canal could be very busy but there are shutters on the windows that helped to quiet the noise. We purchased wine and snacks from a local deli and enjoyed them on the great rooftop patio overlooking the canal and bridge.

Reviews.Title: “a taste of venice”
Reviews.Author: decay1x
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back. Room was small but that was to be expected, We got a room with a good view of the canal although the balcony was very small. A bit noisy as the water taxi stops outside but this was a handy advantage when we got lost it was a straight run along the canal home. The breakfast was satisfactory with good strong coffee as i like it. Room cleaned twice during our stay and had no complaints with towels toiletries etc...Overall an enjoyable stay with top end prices but hey we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for 1st anniversary, a little bit noisy but otherwise perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Stallion32
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Venice and staying at the Rialto hotel (our first was back in March 2010 when I proposed to my wife on the rooftop terrrace of the hotel). We had such an amazing time then, that we decided to come back and celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary here too. Apart from the unfortunate building work that was taking place on the roof terrace this year, everything was exactly the same as we remembered it. Here are some comments: Location: Perfect - you really couldn't ask for any better! There are several vaperetto stops outside the hotel (and a little bit futher down the canal). You can get here from Venice Marco Polo airport very easily by buying a return ticket on the ATVO Airport Express Bus, which takes you non-stop from the airport to Pizalle Roma (the main boat terminal for vaparettos into Venice). The cost is a very reasonable 9 euros for a return ticket which is valid for 7 days. To get to the Hotel from Pizalle Roma, I recommend you take the boat no.2 (red line) towards San Zaccharia (San Marco) - this is a faster service than the no.1 boat, however the 2 may be quite crowded, so taking the no1 maybe better if you have lots of luggage (the no.1 starts from Pizalle Roma). If you are staying in Venice for a few days, I would recommend getting a travelcard for 2, 3, 5 or 7 days. These give you unlimited travel on all vaparettos, and all you have to do is touch your card to the reader before getting on the boat (like an Oyster card reader). The cost for a 3-day card is 37 euros. From the Rialto stops you can get anywhere around the canals/lagoons, but I recommend you study a map of the boat lines first. Once you know where you're going, it's very easy to hop and hop off. You can also walk to lots of places from the Hotel Rialto - St Marks square is about a 5-10min walk away, and there a lots of lovely restaurants and bars nearby. There is a cheap self-service restaurant a couple of doors down from the hotel that does very good meals, pizzas slices and ice cream, definitely worth a look! Hotel Service and Rooms: Just like 2 years ago, the hotel staff could not do more for us. They were very polite and friendly, and spoke perfect english. We were surprised to find a bottle of Proseco waiting in our room once we'd arrived, a very welcome treat! The room was clean, tidy and a decent size (we did pay an extra 150 euros for a canal view room). Bathroom and Shower worked fine and hot water was in plentiful supply. One thing I would point out is that the noise from the canal can get quite irritating if you're a light sleeper, but the view and the atmosphere and ability to people watch overrided this. You may want to consider this when booking a room though. Breakfast was very good! I cannot understand some of the other reviews on here which say breakfast was poor! The selection is very good - cold meats, mini omlettes, croissants, pain au chocolats, fruit, youghurt, fresh juice, and even champagne! You could order extra for a small price, but there's no need. We indulged every morning! Be careful, we were stung with a 12 euro tourist tax at the end of our stay. I would recommend you calrify this with the hotel when you check in, so its not a nasty shock at the end of your stay. All in all, this is great "4" star hotel in a great location. The service and staff are very professional and courteous, the rooms are clean, comfortable and resonably priced, but be careful about the noise from the canal at night, and the tourist tax.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find location but very busy”
Reviews.Author: UK-Based-Explorer
Reviews.Content: It is a picture perfect location at a cost that is easy to find and can not be faulted but as it has been pointed out the tourist traffic makes it a very busy and somewhat noisy site for a hotel, which slightly off sets the great location and amazing view. Rooms were of a good quality, clean and functional. Being in such a busy location has the benefit of a vast array of restaurants and shops on your door step, which is an added bonus. With so much to see in Venice, not much time was spent admiring the view from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but ....”
Reviews.Author: SwissFrenchBrit
Reviews.Content: This is a well-placed "4" star hotel, easy to get to using the vaporetto from the station, situated just next to the Rialto bridge, avoiding pulling your suitcase through narrow streets and over bridges. But Rialto also means lots of tourists, excluding yourselves - gentle readers - and a certain amount of noise. The good news is that youÂ´ll always find it when you return from your walks around Venice - just follow the Rialto signs. The breakfast rooms are crowded even in the low season and the staff are overworked, so you may have to make allowances or even venture out into Venice for breakfast for a coffee. The surrounding restaurants are expensive and disappointing so try to avoid them. The rooms are decorated in what I can only call Las Vegas-Italianate, and may not be to everyoneÂ´s taste, but letÂ´s hope you donÂ´t want to spend too long inside. While the doubles seem "ok", the single room what we had also booked was frankly disappointing. The gentleman on reception seemed affronted when we asked whether there were alternatives. There were not, since this place is often fully booked, and they know it. Unfortunately, the photos are too large to upload of the single room and the building site approx. 2 metres distant, which started work at around 6am every morning ....

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an average price”
Reviews.Author: MartijnG3
Reviews.Content: Location is great, situated next to Rialto bridge, one of the landmarks of Venice. Hotel is not very big, however it does have a lot of stears due to it's structure. Breakfast is average in size but great with fresh sandwishes, eggs and juices every morning

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, noisy with poor breakfast, but reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Thetozers
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, very central easy to get everywhere. We booked a mini suite online, good size room but on 1st floor opposite the ferry/ bus so very very noisy. Would recommend higher floors perhaps. Room was too hot, ac wasn't working, bath plumbing had problems and buffet very poor. But hotel was reasonable and location good for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly convenient, great staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night trip to Venice, staying at this brilliant hotel. The best transport links you could want - bus from outside the airport, then vaporetto direct to the doorstep of the hotel. Staff at the reception desk are exceptionally helpful - they will answer all questions, supply maps etc. The elegance of the hotel may be a little faded in parts but that really didn't spoil our stay. The rooms were kept clean and fresh. We'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: nicola d
Reviews.Content: Having booked early for a"Run of house" room at a really cheap rate, I was expecting a horrible room having read some awful reviews. I went with an open mind hoping for at least clean sheets and a clean bathroom. My son and I were lead through the back alley to the adjoining building and my heart sank a little! However we were both totally amazed at what an absolute brilliant room we had! It definately had that 4 star touch! We actually jumped up and down in sheer excitement! It was a fairly large room, decorated in that typical Venician style and it completely took our breath away! The bathroom was amazing too, complete with large shower unit and heated towel rail. A bonus too that we had a little private terrace which as a smoker it was great to pop out without having to walk all the way out of the hotel for a smoke! (it did however have a resident pidgeon and overlook the back kitchen but I wasn't expecting a canal view!!! lol) Every time we entered the building we could smell the fresh pizza dough being baked and it made our mouths water every time! Couldn't fault the breakfast, the service or the staff! This was our 2nd trip to Venice and having stayed in San polo previously I would definateley choose this location again. I would also stay at Hotel Rialto again! Thank you Rialto for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Unfounded fears”
Reviews.Author: BridgeWYorks
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were not sure what to expect.Our fears were unfounded. the hotel was welcoming,our rooms were on the second floor but our bags were taken up and brought down by the hotel staff. We had two twin rooms, one with shower and one with bath/shower. Both were clean, furnished in the Venitian style very similar to the photos on their web site. Maid service was daily and each evening we were asked if we wanted clean towels again. The mini bar was well stocked and the flat screen tv had BBC,CNN and Eurosport. Our windows opened onto a passage way behind the hotel but there again so must three quarters of the hotels in Venice! We had no noise in the room, slept well, the beds neither too hard or soft as in some reviews! Breakfast was between 7 and 10.30 , omelettes,cold meat, cheese, croissants, pain au chocolate, bread rolls, yoghurt, prunes, fruit cocktail,juice, tea, coffee, chocolate and even proscettio if you wanted to start your day with alcohol! You could have paid more for things off the a la carte but we never did. The location is perfect with the stop for the airport just outside the door. My advice is to go with an open mind, the staff were fine even when I blew the electrics with my hair dryer. By the time I had got back to the room after reporting it, a member of staff had arrived to fix it!!We will definitely be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Given an outdated room in an alleyway, breakfast shocking!”
Reviews.Author: Meshell0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, excited as to what lay in store and couldn't have been more let down. We were greeted by a male receptionist and we checked in shortly afterwards. We were then shown to our room, which you would expect to be within the hotel. In fact, our room was situated out of the hotel, down a dirty alley way and around the corner. We followed the staff member in disbelief as he led us to a door in the middle of the alleyway, where peoples rubbish was strewn. We then had to climb three flights of stairs to our room, which offered no consolation whatsoever. The room itself was dark, dingy, old, tatty and in desperate need of a refurbishment. We could not believe our eyes and our hearts sunk. There were worn furnishings, discoloured carpets, stained lampshades and the shower barely functioned. We later went out for the afternoon and returned to find ants crawling around by our toothbrushes and toiletries, as well as being on the floor. I noted that on our paperwork a sea view had been requested, our view from the room could not have been further from a sea view and when this was questioned, reception virtually laughed and told us that we got what we had paid for. Regardless of its nasty state, we slept there that night but I woke up several times, worried about the security risk, being in this building down the alleyway with no telephone or reception at hand. The next morning, we hoped that breakfast could be our saviour, but not surprisingly, it was also a huge disappointment. The small dining area was very overcrowded, and the food that was on offer was shocking. There were a few stale buns, some wilted ham, tinned fruit, processed orange juice and two jars of cereal. There was of course, hot food available such as toast, eggs, bacon etc, though this was all at an extra charge, which we had not budgeted for as we had been informed that a continental breakfast was included. The photos on the hotel website must have been taken years ago or have been drastically enhanced. If you are going to book, make sure you ask which part of the hotel you will be in. Also, there are no facilities to make a hot drink or even buy one within the hotel, once breakfast is over. My advice...stay at home, it will definitely make you appreciate your own home comforts more!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel living off its location”
Reviews.Author: stephief
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we couldn't get into the Vivaldi (which is absolutely wonderful). Having paid a fair wack for a junior suite with a canal view we couldn't have been more disappointed. To be fair we did have a view of the grand canal and Rialto bridge but the window was so narrow you had to lean out quite precariously to get a good look. As it is the winter season, the bar and restaurant are closed. Although the reception staff assured us we could get beverages from room service, no one answered the phone on the occasions we rang. We had to actually leave the hotel and find a cafe to have a cup of tea. I really think you ought to be able to get a hot drink in a four star hotel. The room, as others have said, was nothing like that which was portrayed in the brochure. It was dingy, damp, not particularly clean and could have done with a good makeover. I am not sure what has gone on in the wardrobe but our clothes developed a very strange smell after being in there! The piece de resistance was the queen size bed - err midget queen!! which was actually two single beds pushed together with a wooden ridge between the two. It was the most uncomfortable, unromantic offering you can imagine which gave us both the three most uncomfortable nights sleep ever. We did try and raise our concerns about the quality of the room with the reception staff but they were completely uninterested and did nothing to appease or rectify the situation. Luckily Venice is such a wonderful place of such beauty that you can't help but have a fabulous time other wise the hotel would have ruined our trip. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, yes the location is handy but there are a million others which must be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: MissMellyP
Reviews.Content: Whilst the room I stayed in was fine, and the bathroom in line with general standards in Venice, it was nothing particularly special, and nor was my parents' room either, which was quite outdated. That said, friends we were travelling with were upgraded to a room with windows opening onto the canal, and that room was wonderful. I loved the hotel balcony where you could sit and enjoy a Bellini without actually being down on the canal in amongst the hustle and bustle. I did get a bit cranky with the pigeons waking me up every morning on my window sill, but that's hardly the fault of the hotel, and probably made more annoying by the fact I had just arrived from Australia (where I left immediately after the working week) and was jet lagged. Definitely paying for the location here, which, in my book, was worth it. I enjoyed other hotels I paid similar prices for across other countries in Europe on this trip, and they had better rooms, but also didn't have the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rialto, Venice - You are Not a 4 Star - Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CinziaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 2 nights at this hotel. It was a non refundable internet rate of $120.00 euro per night. It was a Christmas present to myself. The photo that I was shown on the internet upon booking was nothing like the room I was given. In fact the photos are misleading. When I checked in, the man that took my bag up to my room looked like he hated his job. When he opened the door to my room, my heart sank. I had booked a Classic double room with Rialto bridge view. I got the view from a small window and I was taller than the window...if I sat down in a chair I could see the bridge. I did get a fantastic picture when I leaned out the window...but, you can also get fantastic pictures of the bridge by standing in front of the hotel or riding the water bus. I thought maybe there was a mistake. So I went back down to the front desk to ask them about the room. I was polite with my enquiry but, the man assisting me was very rude and condescending, in fact, I have another word to describe him. He said, "Well WHAT were you expecting for a standard room?!!!" "Tell me!" Come on Hotel Rialto you don't talk to your guests like that. I have been to Europe and stayed in many different types of accommodation so I am not naive. They got someone to show me another room and the man showing the room was just as bad as the man that carried my bag to my room. I decided to stay in the room that I had. My room was really far up in some corner...room 306. On my last night, I decided to put the card out on the door for room service for the next morning. I had put it out before the cut off time (in fact early), but no one had bothered to come by. Upon checkout I clunked my baggage down the stairs and the man who had initially helped me upon check in saw me and kept walking. I felt like I was in the Munsters House...what a joke! I had just stayed at the Hotel Pesaro Palace for 3 nights and that is a 4 star hotel. I got an internet deal and paid only $10 euro more per night with an amazing view of the Grand Canal. I would have stayed there but they were sold out after my 3 night booking. I think in my haste to book, I must have forgotten to read the feedback about the Rialto. If you are planning to book here for a special occasion..think of this as a 2-3 star European hotel and what you might expect. Also, anyone who has problems walking...there are a lot of stairs... I expect this with European hotels but some might not know this and the staff do not go out of their way to help you. I managed to get out and enjoy the last 2 days of my stay in Venice but the way I was treated at this hotel was still seared in my mind and I will never book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but location was handy”
Reviews.Author: Dane0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2010 for 1 night on our honeymoon as our first stop in Italy. I am not sure what other hotels are like in Venice but was rather disappointed in this one for the price I paid. The room was clean but not the greatest in furnishings/lighting/bathroom. The lift wasn't working in the hotel at the time as well. The good thing is the location. It was a quick trip on the ferry from the train station. It was also easy to find your way back to the hotel when you get lost as there are signs frequently for Ponte di Rialto. We also ate at the restaurant downstairs where I had my worst meal of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Accomodations but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jks784
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the spring of 2010 for a weekend. The room was booked months in advance for a "junior suite w/canal view" prepaid of course so no refunds if something were to change. The location was wonderful, right by the water taxi stop and the bridge. BUT our first night we were in the room that over looked the taxi stop. Which a boat is there every 15 mins or so and when the people were getting off they could practically walk in our room. We requested another room and ended up in some back corridor, had to climb some steep steps (no railing and my aunt walks with a cane and we weren't told this). The room had a small window that if you climbed up and hung outside you could look down at the steps of the Rialto. Breaking your neck while hanging out the window would get you a great view of the Grand Canal. So again, requested a new room (paid a lot of money so figured we should ask since the view we were thinking of didn't include hanging out a window, which we could only do one at a time) and finally got the best room which was overlooking the canal, had doors you could open and was high enough and just to the right of the taxi stop. Room was good sized, bathroom was decent, didn't have to walk miles to get to the room. Of course it was the last night we were there. The staff at the front desk were men so they were rude and condescending to us. One in particular. There were 3 of us women so not sure what his problem towards us was. The breakfast was okay. Like most italian hotels I've stayed at you have to eat early since towards the end pickings are slim at times. I don't think it was worth the money for what was charged. Basically it was the location and if lucky the view of the bridge from your room. The route to St. Marks Square was confusing and easy to get confused but close to the hotel. Anything close to tourist attractions seems to be very pricey for food. We did get a free trip to a glass factory on Murano where we must have looked like poor relations since the owner didn't push us to buy. Probably figured we spent all our money paying for the high priced hotel! Had a very expensive ride to the airport in the morning. Oh, and if taking a gondola ride don't take the one right out front the hotel. I know they basically all charge the same but it was 100 euros and I felt like we were in the gondola for all of 15 mins. I'd say find somewhere not in the main tourist sections unless there is something you'd really want to see. We found taking the water taxis around you could get some great photos if you could get a seat or stand by the railing. Another FYI on the water taxis.....they pack the people on! Be careful getting from the platform (which sometimes is moving) to the boat which is also moving.

Reviews.Title: “A dissapointing place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: George_Gx
Reviews.Content: We arrived there in our honey moon coming from an excellent hotel in Rome and my expectations were quite high considering the price we've paid for the room. The hotel is located in front of the busiest place in Venice, the Rialto Bridge. There is a boat station right in front of the hotel and the place was really busy and noisy all day long (and night). The staff was rude and they barely answered to our questions. The rooms were big but everything looked old. The bathroom was clean but small and you could easily see that everything was old and barely functional. The rooms had only 2 electrical sockets and we had to unplug the TV to charge our phones. No wireless internet in the rooms, just in the lobby and we had to pay for it. The breakfast was very poor and the so called restaurant was really small. I don't recommend this hotel for staying when you visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic.”
Reviews.Author: R0land69
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel , amazing central location , fantastic suite of rooms.Superb location to spend our second wedding anniversary.Staff organised champagne and roses.Go visit !

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very pokey.”
Reviews.Author: Goffo25
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and had most necessities. However we had to climb 59 steep stairs to reach our room, which would not suit anyone with low fitness or massive packs! Power points didnt work in the bathroom which was a nuisance, had to unplug the fridge to use a hair straightener. Front concierge was very abrupt and not very welcoming. However great location, and suitable for a place to sleep, close to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: katrina3043
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in early March and it was till a bit cold. It was nice as you can get to the hotel without having to take water taxis and saves quite a bit of money. The buffet in the morning was decent and hot food was available. We stayed in a triple room with my 5 year old and there was more than enough room for everything. Also room had safe and that's always a bonus for us. From train/bus station follow signs for Rialto Bridge and not more than 20min walk. Very conveniently located to lots of shops and food. There was a pizza place to the left of the hotel tiny whole in the wall but great pizza and cheap. Like 5 Euro for 3 slices and a drink. We stayed off season so got the room for cheap. Bonus is that there is a terrace you can use to take pictures off of and the bridge views are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Marianne K
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The room we had was all the way on the side facing Calle larga Mazzarin. This didn't bother us, but was a bit of a journey coming and going to and from the hotel. One criticism of the hotel would be their "Extra Breakfast", even though this was only 5.50 Euro and after having had continental breakfast for over a week thought I would get something different was very disappointed in getting a small dish of 2 eggs with some prociutto on top which had been microwaved, not only that but half the eggs were cooked and the other half not. Not very nice. So my advise don't get the extra breakfast. I think for a 4 star hotel they could at least cook the eggs and bacon on a pan or at least note to guest that it will be microwaved to warn them. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean, however a little threadbare. Would recommend the hotel. The hotel is right near the Rialto bridge and easy to get to from the Vaporetto. Easy to walk to anywhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for location”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us in this hotel in September and I didnt bother to check out the reviews because I saw where the location was, it was expensive and it looked great on their website. Like some previous reviewers we actually ended up in an adjacent building on the first floor (they called it floor 5) after a journey through the back alleys behind the actual hotel. The room was VERY small and at best 2 star. At first we thought we had also been dudded on the view as well, until we discovered that by using a chair and climbing out our window we ended up on the hotel balcony with the most majestic view over the grand canal and the Rialto Bridge. This was the only room with a window to the balcony. Without this unintentional bonus it would have been a terrible stay, but that balcony and the view erased any ill feelings we had. For the record the room number was 502, so if you DO end up staying at the Rialto and get put in the neighbouring building try getting that room! Breakfast was sparse and crowded and there was not much else to get excited about at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Daniel P
Reviews.Content: Well where to start with this Hotel. You had to go down lots of alleys before you even got to your room from the hotel entrance.The alleys stunk. When you got inside the room it was tiny and had no view what so ever. The breakfast was terrible. there was hardly no choice of food what so ever. This hotel is never a 4 Star more like a 1 star. Hotel was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Total ripoff.”
Reviews.Author: DaisyMaeBeresford
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this room was its size. It was quite large with the twin beds my sister and I requested. The room was absolutely filthy. The room was probably decorated in the 60's or 70's and not touched since. The fabric covered walls were stained with everything imaginable. The carpet had not been vacuumed as we found much evidence of the previous guests. The bathroom tiles were cracked and the bathroom was crawling with ants because some one dropped some crumbs of some sort and they hadn't been picked up. Our Grand Canal view was of the exit ramp of the busiest Vaporetto stop on the canal. And we were only 10 feet above it. Every five minutes the boat stopped here and hordes of people came charging up the ramp right in the direction of our open window which we couldn't keep open for long. Now one could only assume that maybe 440 Euros ($642 Can.) per night would get you something decent. Apparently Not in Venice! We didn't even bother to point any of these horrible deficiencies out to the staff. We just went straight out to look for a decent hotel and fled the next morning as fast as we could. And we got something really beautiful for a mere 700 Euros ($1022 Can.) per night. Take a wheelbarrow full of money when you go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Way better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: maromatic
Reviews.Content: I did hours and hours of research looking for just the right hotel in Venice. There are so many to choose from and so many locations to consider. We opted out of a room with a canal view, although we could see it from the two windows if we leaned out...which was just fine. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room. We were out exploring. Our room was larger than most...from chatting with other guests. I am not sure what class of room I booked...but we had a large bathroom with double sinks and a shower over tub configuration. The room was spacious by Venetian standards. Was very comfortable. The location was fantastic! Every time we walked out the front door, we could look to our right the Rialto Bridge was RIGHT there! Fabulous!!! Breakfast was good, we opted to sit outside in a tiny courtyard. It was fun watching all the people on their way to work hustling thru the narrow corridor. Would stay here again in a heartbeat! PS: be sure to search out the little outdoor patio a few floors up. GREAT place to unwind and share a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Scary and awful”
Reviews.Author: Kaishopper
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. They booked me into a room out the back in an alley. As a young woman traveling on my own I am not afraid to say these guys are rip off merchants. The room I am currently staying in has stains on the walls, batteries hanging out of the remote, light shades hanging off the walls with burns?, cobwebs around the windows a smell of death and to make matters worse you have to walk up the back of nowhere to get there. It is that bad that I needed to review it right now. This hotel is terrible - it's worse than a hostel- a bit like a horror movie. Like you have stepped into a Dracula movie. don't pay $300 per night in non peak season to stay in this horrible place. Have never felt so unsafe or so unwelcome. To those who run this awful hotel- the next time a young woman walks in on her own from another country- don't make her stay in the back alley in the room of death.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: 576Rosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early October and although the rooms are small, the panoramic terrace certainly made up for it. What travellers forget is that you are not here to stay in your room but to get out and enjoy the sites of venice and the room size is typical of Italy. Staying on the grand canal was fabulous, although the noise is constant. There are plenty of good ristorantes nearby as well as transport. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Don015
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Venice with 3 other couples and we found the "Rialto" was a excellent choice.Rooms were small as they are in Europe. Rooms were one floor up from the front desk and were easily accessible. Breakfast was very good. Central location to places of interest was beneficial. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and shabby and in need of investment”
Reviews.Author: LizW_NickG
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rialto is located right by the famous Rialto Bridge and as such is a great location. The decor in our rooms (two - one for the children and one for us) was dated and tatty. We had to ask for a different room for the children because it was damp - plaster peelling off the walls and that asthma inducing reek of wet walls. The staff were courteous about our request and were able to change the room for the rest of our 4 night stay. Breakfast was dull. A sad array of limp ham, supermarket salami, tired bread rolls and cold hard boiled eggs. The coffee was vile. however - when it came to checking out the reception staff had deducted the entire mini-bar bill from our account by way of apology. We hadn't made a fuss - we had been polite and in return they made a gesture which was kindly received. No we wouldnt go back but we did leave thinking that they did what they could to make things better. Will someone please invest in this sad old hotel and bring it up to the 21st century? The location is surely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for Staying”
Reviews.Author: Janey H
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in Oct 2011 and paid over euro 250 per night! The room in first night which not in main building. You need to walk through the terrible and dirty corridor outside the hotel, then open the metal door, no elevator, climb a stairs, then arrive the room located in Mezzanine Floor. Washroom bigger than sleeping room and unsafe location!! I complained to front desk for changing room BUT answer was "Sorry, madam! Full house today and you were the last one for checking in. Nothing can be changed!" What you felt when you heard the answer? Lucky, back to main building for 2nd & 3rd night but totally destroyed my holiday in Venice. How it get 4 stars as treated and CHEATED its guests like this! Be careful, the hotel web site does not mentioned anything about M/F, just shown the room picture in Main Building! Totally do not recommend to stay even good location but noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: clairess_11
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The location is amazing, staff very friendly and helpful. We had a side room so it was nice and quiet. Very pleasant to sit on the terrace and watch the Grand Canal go by. The rooms are a little shabby, but we didn't mind as they really belonged to historic Venice. Breakfast was lovely and good quality, sitting outside just meters away from the Grand Canal. They offer a free trip to Murano island, just go forwarned- its a great excursion but the staff at the glass factory put the hard sell on you to buy something when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Old but in perfecy location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros D
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a fantastic location on the river overlooking the well â€“ known bridge of Rialto. Quite old like a maze with relatively small rooms. Although it is old, it is in good price if you consider its location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: sydcar
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel while in Venice, and although the location is very good being right on the Grand Canal on the Railto Bridge, don't expect to get any sleep especially in a front room. Because of it's location it is very busy and the noise continues all night, loading and unloading barges and radios blaring in the taxi boats. The hotel is also very overpriced for the conditions you get, Our room was small, tired looking and in need of renovation, Also the room was not very clean and the sheets very itchy for some reason. The bathroom is basic at best - not what I expected for the four star rating. The continental breakfast was very basic also. The staff when we arrived were very helpful, but the staff in the morning of check out not so! Try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars is quite a stretch!”
Reviews.Author: QueerTravelers
Reviews.Content: This tattered, stale old maze of a hotel sits directly across from the very noisy and busy Rialto Bridge and Vaporetto stop, so if you want quiet, do not stay here. While our room was large, it needed considerable sprucing up, carpet cleaning, paint, etc. The color scheme was a nauseating pink, and no amount of sprucing would counter its intense kitsch. The shower leaked gallons every use, and the toilet didn't flush very well. The breakfast was horribly lame, as was the curt front desk personnel. I had questioned my travel agent's recommendation of this hotel after reading very mixed reviews here and should have trusted my instincts and stayed elsewhere. That said, if you want to be right on the bridge, require only the basics, and can sleep through constant noise beneath your window, then maybe one of the bridge view rooms is for you--the view was indeed spectacular from our room, although not so great from others in the same pricey category. However, all rooms are quite overpriced, all things considered, and for my money, I'd choose something in better condition on a side canal in the future. Perhaps the staff will at least pretend they give a flip at another establishment. At checkout, the hotel tried to charge us for beers from the minibar (I haven't had a drink in years), and when we asked for the charge to be removed, one clerk questioned the error, and the other clerk responded (in Italian he didn't think we could understand), "Oh, just give them the money back and send them on their way!" Lovely--don't worry, we don't plan on returning anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Susan F
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for two nights at the beginning of this month (Sept. 2011) and cannot rate the hotel highly enough. The room was spotless, a good size with brocade fabric panelled walls and a beautiful Venetian glass chandelier. It was very comfortable, good bed and air conditioning. The shower room was small but fine. The location was amazing, the breakfast terrace was really close to the Rialto Bridge and watching the bustle of Venice starting its day while we ate our breakfast was quite amazing. The roof terrace was lovely although we were out and about nearly all the time using the vaporettos; the stop was immediately outside the hotel. Our room was at the side of the hotel so it was nice & quiet. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We hope to go back again next year to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: SidcupWhinger
Reviews.Content: Very busy part of the city - most major attractions within 15 mins walk. Nice roof terrace to watch the canal from - take your own bottle up there. Handy for the Alilaguna express water bus from Marco Polo Airport. Took our own travel kettle and used mini-bar for keeping milk. All in all very enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “I agree with Chris S on his review, but...”
Reviews.Author: marzyns
Reviews.Content: This place is about location, location, location. But it has another really great feature, one difficult to come by in Venice: elevator!!! a rare commodity in this town, as I was told at another place in which we stayed and I wouldn't recommend (Castello hotel near Saint Mark's Sq.) "hotel sin Venice don't have elevators", but when I told him I had stayed at one of the Best Western hotels in town by the Hard Rock Cafe DID have an elevator the receptionist told me that the municipality won't allow new applications elevators in old buildings. So... if you're traveling light maybe you don't want to pay for a hotel that will cost you 100 eu more than a hotel without an elevator, but we did appreciate it. the staff was ok, but they suffer from the "we Italians are high above anyone else" syndrome, which we suffered at a Costa line Cruise as well. What a shame, Italians used to be the nicest people in Europe. But back to the Rialto hotel: breakfast was ok, nothing special, cereal, great coffe, some kinds of bread, doughnuts, and boiled eggs. Some sliced cheese and something similar to ham. Another great feature is the closeness to the water, just outside the door, transportation in Venice is by its waterways, to get to the airport you either take the public water bus or a private taxi-boat, so if your plane leaves early in the morning it's very convenient. the bathroom was roomy, had an old fashioned hair dryer, so if you have long, abundant hair bring your own or plan to spend 1 hour to dry your hair ladies! Mine is short and very thin so no problem there. Cleanliness? Maybe 3.5 out of 5, the shower had some black corners as a result of old caulking, but not that bad. Anyhow, in a nutshell, I would recommend this place if you're willing to spend an average of 250 euros per night, which is not bad for expensive Venice.

Reviews.Title: “enter with caution”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Although situated right on the Hotel by The rialto bridge small shabby rooms and arrogant unhelpful staff spoil the experience. No tea/coffee facilities and you are forced to get ripped off at the cafe next door . Very noisy locality

Reviews.Title: “Oooo La La”
Reviews.Author: gibsonchop
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right by the Rialto Bridge and right by a Ferry stop on the Grand Canal. You are surrounded by restaurants, although tourist many can be tourist traps but you are experiencing a city that runs mostly on tourism!!! The hotel is large and our room was right next to the Panoramica. It is a terrace that overlooks the Grand Canal. We had just came from two hotels up north in Germany and Austria that did not have air conditioning but The Hotel Rialto did and our room was ice cold!!!! It was August when we visited and were so glad our room was cool to sleep in. It is quite hot and sweaty in August to visit Venice but the city itself is a site to see. So we were glad to stay here and experience the energy that was taking place all around us. www.gibsonchop.com

Reviews.Title: “Venice met all our expectations and then some!”
Reviews.Author: WStravel11
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we must mention that we stayed in a Junior Suite on the 3rd floor of the hotel which overlooked the Rialto Bridge. From our observations, other rooms were quite small. However, our room, whilst decorated in a typically Venetian style, was spacious and comfortable. The view from the window provided hours of delightful insight into the activities on the canal. The many sights and sounds were hard to avoid, although when you closed the windows and shutters, the room became completely soundproof. Room was airconditioned which made for a very comfortable retreat after a day in the italian heat. The hotel comes complete with restaurant and very friendly staff who accommodate all of your wants and needs. The hotel is centrally located for eating, shopping and taking that all important gondola ride. Positioning of the hotel is most important. You have a choice of water taxi or ferry. The water taxis and ferries stop right outside the hotel, which is very convenient. We can recommend the taxis although they will cost 50+ euros from the train station to the hotel. The ferry is often cramped and difficult to manoeuvre your baggage on and off at the ferry dock. St Marks Square is a short ten minute walk from the hotel. Here you will find many other shops to wet your appetite and eateries together with the tourist sights in the square. One can quite easily spend an afternoon sitting in the shade, sipping coffee and listening to a wonderful four piece band with a lovely repetoire of classical italian and romantic music. To eat at this point, whilst wonderful, is a bit expensive, but worth it. We enjoyed many of the eateries along the canal adjacent to the Rialto Bridge and the hotel. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a little outdated. Great friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Viaticatus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rialto is right by the Rialto bridge, which is great and bad, since the spot is crowded with tourists getting on and off the bridge and the nearby vaporetto stop. It's righ on the canal, by many shops and restaurants, a very interesting stroll away from the piazza San Marco. Breakfast was included, not many options but good. The room we got was 10 steps up rom the elevator, so managing two large heavy bags was a challenge, room decor is in an old "Italian" style, ancient tv, good bathroom. Great view to the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: LMVB26
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here. The location is excellent - right by the Rialto, and about 15-20 mins walk to the Square. Very nice reception staff. No internet in the rooms - two computers at reception (vouchers can be purchased at reception). One of our rooms was huge (twin), the other very small (double). Both rooms were nicely furnished. Our rooms were located in a separate annex from the main hotel, down a few very smelly (and dark at night) alleyways. If i was traveling by myself, as a female, I wouldn't like walking back to my room at night. Check where your room is located before you book if you are worried. One negative - breakfast was pretty average. Don't let this put you off, a very good hotel overall we thought. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only location”
Reviews.Author: LVJI
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, however, It seems this hotel invested in its 4 stars long time ago - everything is outdated: very noisy old air conditioner, after shower leaking bath, safe with a metal key, lift that you can use only up to 1st floor, narrow stairs, poor breakfast, etc.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful will stay agian”
Reviews.Author: pat2212
Reviews.Content: staff friendly, restaurant outside on the canal, gorgeouse breakfast,very old but refurbished a lot of stairs but worth it for the view. thank you rialto

Reviews.Title: “total ripoff”
Reviews.Author: volbe
Reviews.Content: made a reservation online and looked like a beautiful place.... the reality was totally different....we was taken to another building that had an access from a small alley where people left they garbage... the view(what was the main reason why we chose the hotel)was something else....not even to a alley let alone to the canal but to a stair that went to someones balcony.... hate to think what the cheapest rooms look like when this was so horrible!!! the service....what service!?!?!? nothing was explained nor they even told us that the breakfast was included in the room price!!! the rooms didn't even look like in the web page at all....blood in the wall...dirty lamp shades....holes in the wall... with the rooms cost 140â‚¬/night would think you get something little better!!!! i travel lot with my work and been in some very shady hotels in eastern europe but this was really one of the worst one i ever been!!!

Reviews.Title: “Does not come close to 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: emo88
Reviews.Content: Great location in front of the historic Rialto Bridge however, the greatness ends there. We provided our passport when checking in for registration however, they were only returned on request. Front desk was more concerned about his unrelated phone conversations rather then acknowledging our presence especially when trying to return room keys this occured on multiple occasions. Breakfast was included in our booking but many simple food such as bacon, scrambled eggs, etc. were at extra cost. When we checked out, front desk staff (same one who checked us in) made no attempt to make eye contact at any stage or asked if we had enjoyed our stay. Will return to Venice not Hotel Rialto. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “This is Venice!”
Reviews.Author: billhammer
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel room with a view of the Grand Canal. As a wonderful bonus, we were given one of the rooms with a balcony. The room was great. Nicely appointed, A/C worked well, windows block out the "busy" noises(I didn't even need to wear earplugs and I am a light sleeper.) The rooftop terrace was a little tricky to find the first time, but a terrific spot to strech out and drink the champagne we bought for a really good price in the store directly below. We found the hotel staff very helpful. We loved the bustle and busyness of the area, as we were 20 feet above it and part of it but away from it. Great pictures of all types of watercraft and people doing their thing. Breakfast was not elaborate, but seeing as how we were going on a cruise, less was more.

Reviews.Title: “The beautiful Hotel Rialto”
Reviews.Author: LynnRoebuck
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rialto is located in the historic portion which is the very heart of Venice. Our lovely room overlooked the beautiful Grand Canal and the16th century Rialto Bridge. We had large easy to open windows which was wonderful for enjoying the amazing views. In my opinion the hotel service was excellent and the staff more than helpful. Also the hotel is located in a nice location for longs walks around Venezia. Gas fumes from the boats were strong at times but even now I close my eyes and still hear the groaning of the mooring lines.

Reviews.Title: “medium quality”
Reviews.Author: Elihartmann
Reviews.Content: Medium hotel, not so posh but prices are well calibrated. Venice is very expensive city this hotel is quite affordable but noisy. Breakfast was REALLY poor but well fit the price. Nice medium hotel if you are on budget. Suggested for young couples not if you're looking for charme or luxury position. We liked that it look so italian.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: KarePhilBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very helpful friendly staff. The view from the front rooms is spectacular. Not suitable if you struggle with stairs though. The rooms are very old but very clean. Would have liked a bigger selection for breakfast but on the whole a lovely stay. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great aspect”
Reviews.Author: Russell T
Reviews.Content: we booked well before travelling to Venice at the Hotel Rialto, literally right over the famous ponte, there are only 28 canal rooms, so book one of these as you have the greatest view of the 24 hour canal activities. The room is smallish, as are all Venice rooms but with a canal stop right out front and everything nearby its a real treat for firs timers, like me to Venice. Russell and Robyn Thomas. Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “location only good thing”
Reviews.Author: mare440
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we stayed at in four cities in Italy. Location is excellent. Had to walk up many flights of stairs to room. Breakfast - very unappealing. Desk staff rude and uncaring for the most part. The day we checked out, we left suitcases - they were put in a closet which was unlocked when we returned and we had to move all of the suitcases in front of ours out of the closet to get to ours -- while the desk staff watched and did not help. Would not recommend and would definitely not return.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best view!!”
Reviews.Author: zcassar22
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated just a few metres away from the famous Rialto Bridge of Venice. The Hotel was fully air-conditioned and the rooms were always clean. The only disappointing problem was the size of the bathrooms as you would find it hard to reach your toes when taking a shower. On the whole the service was great and the receptionists were very helpful when explaining which attractions to visit in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “what relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: 60Nretired Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: arrived suitably clued up, what not to do,who not to trust,five hours late. Only to find a lovely hotel room and staff.Desk man very helpful. being over 60 and not understanding computers,try an Italian one its all the wroung way round,after a lesson from the helpful desk man all went well. Prices well I pay Â£2 for an ice cream on Isle of Wight, proper Venice one Â£1.50. ???

Reviews.Title: “Yes it was a good location, but who cares?”
Reviews.Author: mcommins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one to avoided. Here are the facts. We checked in and were forced to surrender our passports whilst they made copies. The male staff member was very rude and offered no advice or tips about Venice. Now, I don't have a problem with giving my passport, this but he insisted he take our passports and keep them for a period of time whilst they had time to complete registration. As an Australian I have always been taught to guard your passport with your life!! The staff at Rialto Venice really don't understand this concept and I'll tell you why. When we eventually checked out of this hotel, we had plenty of time to kill so we just sat in the lobby area close to reception. What we witnessed was very interesting indeed. Every new guest checking in were told the same deal about the passports and all were very nervous about leaving their passports with reception. Furthermore an American guy was really upset with the fact that he discovered his luggage was not locked up when he left it with hotel staff during the day. Anyway, the room we stayed in was huge, but very very tired indeed. You could hear rats in the walls at night, but to the hotel's credit, I think they are trying to resolve this issue. The balcony is ok at best as you don't have any view unless you stand up and peer over the edge. It's not like you can sit at a table and have a drink with a view! Also, breakfast was terrible. There was very little variety and the pastries were horrible. The only positive thing about this hotel was the air conditioner in the room worked really well. Forget about the good location, find a better place!!! Venice has an excellent public water ferry system which runs virtually every 5 minutes to take you anywhere (so trust me, a good location is not an advantage in Venice). This was the worst hotel we stayed at in Europe and I consider myself easy going.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: ivanwSale
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. Some of the staff are abrupt, lift to level one, our room was at the top in level 3 but it is six flights all over the place, Disaster waitng to happen.

Reviews.Title: “One word - bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Solo54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Railto for three nights in June 2011. The hotel is located centrally and that's why we chose it. Front desk staff were abrupt when we checked in but they were quick to fix a couple of issues with our room. The hotel is tired and the breakfasts were not that great but...........we saw Venice. However, both of us have several bites that seem to be bedbugs. We are now home in the US and hope we haven't brought the creatures with us. The bites are exactly as pictured on Internet websites. Also, there are other references to bedbugs at The Railto on line...................For three nights, it was $750.00 for a small room with a view of an alley, a smelly bathroom with a floor drain that gurgled suspiciously when one flushed the toilet and the sink dripped non stop underneath onto the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandi_hayes1
Reviews.Content: Ignore the miserable comments this was a great hotel. The terrace was fab. A trip to the nearby co-op for a couple of bottles of vino blanco or Rossi and yr done for the evening. Reception staff were brilliant and so helpful!! I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandi_hayes
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the moans about this hotel. In terms of excellent supportive front desk, SUPERB location - right next to the rialto bridge, by taxi stops, gondolas and traghettis this hotel is amazing. BUT if you want a spacious hotel, with a swimming pool forget it, it's lovely and quirky, with a great atmosphere and the best thing is the terrace that you can sit on in the evening and watch the world go by with a bottle of wine brrough from the nearby co-op for 3 euros!. I really couldn't rate this higher than 5 although I wanted to. When I read some other comments I was a bit concerned that it would be dingy and small - but it isn't. I don't think we could have picked a better hotel in terms of location. I had to rate no parking - but it's Venice - no cars anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Roonie4
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights here and loved it. The location is great if you want to be in the heart of things. Our room overlooked the Canal and Bridge and we could just sit and watch life as it happened. The staff were helpful, confirming Opera tickets for us without any hassel. Breakfast was fine and I have to agree with another reviewer the roof terrace was a big plus. The rooms aren't enormous but you are staying in an old building that has been converted to a hotel and a modern purpose built soulless hotel. Would certainly come here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: U3
Reviews.Content: perfect location for short stay in venice. room adequate and breakfast ok. we paid around 200 euro a night in april which is probably enough. we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, with a lovely panoramic roof terrace overlooking Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge.”
Reviews.Author: Jimco22
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to Venice, and would definitely return to this hotel for the superb location. An unexpected bonus was the roof terrace, where it is possible to relax and enjoy the hustle and bustle going on below - day and night - and without the noise! Yes the hotel is a bit tired-looking, but our room was large with a side view of the canal, quite clean and the king-size bed very comfortable. I enjoyed the bath although anyone larger than a size 14 would have great difficulty getting in - let alone trying to get out!!

Reviews.Title: “1 star pretending to be 4 and charging for the location”
Reviews.Author: 007foodcritic
Reviews.Content: 1 star, very small rooms, a rabbit Warren fire trap, poor lighting, decor lost in previous decades - only good thing about it was the location. However, Venice is like the hotel, a place trading on past reputation. We left after a day. There are nicer places in Italy with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: REBurwell
Reviews.Content: So yes, it is a bit run down and mismash inside the hotel like other reviewers have noted. However, I've stayed in another hotel in Venice and I much preferred the traditional, authentic(if a little worn at times) Hotel Rialto. It definitely made me think that I was staying in Venice!!! The location is PERFECT and if you're not a total fuss pot then you can appreciate that! You get off the vaporetto at the stop and there it is. Check in was smooth, no issues and the staff were friendly. Although I checked in in Italian, the staff at the front desk also spoke excellent English. Yes the route to the room was windy and confusing but we saw it as quirky and an adventure, and not the downside that others have seen it. The beds were comfortable, there was air conditioning and a fully stocked mini bar. The shower was great, the windows opened onto the streets below. We had a "triple room" There is a rooftop patio that is AWESOME! I would recommend this hotel just for that patio. When my daughter was having a nap in the afternoon my mom and grandma sat up there in the sunshine watching the action on the grand canal. Then that evening when we were done wandering around for the night we sat up there and had a glass of wine. Seriously, I've stayed at hotels all over Europe and while the decorating is outdated in this one, it works. If you're one of those picky, fussy people then perhaps this ISN'T the place for you, but we loved it and I'd recommend it to others. The price.......well hey, i don't think anything is worth what you pay in Venice, but its Venice, so suck it up!!!! we paid 269 Euros a night last weekend and four of us slept in the room.....not TOO bad for Venice. The breakfast buffet was great, much better than some European hotels where its a brioche and espresso and that's it!!! there was quite a variety of food. Hope this review helped!!!

Reviews.Title: “A 1 star hotel pretending to be a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: 007foodcritic
Reviews.Content: Do not go there! Overpriced with small expensive room; limited choice breakfast. Only good thing is the location but Venice, like this hotel, is trading on past reputation - Venice is dirty, smelly, rats at night and crumbling; why go there? I left after 1 day.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth its price”
Reviews.Author: MayTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the hotel is not worth its price. The personnel are making their best (most of the time), but there are some planning / management problems: - No Internet in the rooms; you have to go to reception to catch WiFi. The Internet is not included in the price and is expensive - Smell in the rooms - At times, non renovated walls / ceiling (with traces of something looking like the old moisture) - No quilt covers (even when asked for), only bed sheets + plain quilts

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL ON CANAL”
Reviews.Author: dru48GG
Reviews.Content: we took a bus from airport to water taxi , got off at rio alto bridge.walk to the bridge and down walkway (don't go over bridge) you come to open courtyard go across courtyard go to the left to a walkway that takes you under a building. look for a small alleyway to the left make another left then turn right, you come to a lovely pub. at pub turn right then left again the hotel office on left. hotel barelomeo is the check in for hotel roi alto hotel, after check in they take your bags back thru alleyway to walkway to a great big wooden door, the rialto bridge it right there. no elevator, we where on 3rd floor over looking canal.room a little small but all are, clean and cozy. breakfast is at hotel bartelomeo it's not but one block in the states. great location in beautiful place next to canals, shopping, resturants,pubs. take walking shoes, get a map of the place and off you go,easy to get around and us the water taxi go up and down the canal, get off and on. this place is amazing, loved it all food was great eat outside along canal or inside, the pubs had good food also. i'd go back tomorrow

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG HORROR”
Reviews.Author: antjane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. My daughter recieved 13 bed bug bites and I had 5. Room was not very clean. Stains on lounges. Air con didn't work so windows had to be kept open allowing dozens of mosqitoes to enter the room as well as outside noise that kept us awake all night. We had to purchase insect spray ourselves and and spray the room just to make it bearable. There is no way this hotel can be described as 4 star. 2-3 star at best. Pictures on website and brochure look great but in reality the decor looks really bad. Worst hotel we have ever stayed in. On the positive side the location was great but I think I would rather camp out on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JohnPGrant
Reviews.Content: On the Grand Canal, overlooking the Rialto Bridge, easily accessible from Marco Polo Airport and at the very heart of all the major sights, this must be the best located hotel in Venice. Elegant, comfortable and friendly, it is excellent value. I wouldn't stay anywhere else - but remember to spring for a Bridge view room.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: ferrellhoust
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. We took a water taxi to it from the airport. It was like 130 euros round trip, but what a way to arrive in Venice. Once we got inside we realized this Hotel also has mandatory health club membership- No elevators past the 2nd floor. Which wasn't so bad, it kind of put us back in time, just as the rooms did. Great place to see Venice from, centrally located, good breakfast, mini bar in room. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good Value. Charming.”
Reviews.Author: swmpls
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Excellent location next to Rialto Bridge. Very easy to find and you never get lost in Venice as all roads point you back to Rialto (literally!). Very centrally located. Rooms are fine and clean but nothing too fancy. Our room was all pink with a crystal chandelier. Easy to get to. From the airport we took the bus to the Piazza Roma,...$3 euro each and we walked from there in about 20 minutes. If you have luggage you can take a water bus (vaporetti) and there is stop right in front of the hotel. Make sure to check out the hotel terrace overlooking the canal. The staff encouraged us to bring our own wine up there and we enjoyed the sunset all by ourselves. Wifi is extra charge and available in the lobby only. Great place to enjoy Venice because of the easy location. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great first time stay.”
Reviews.Author: ZoePR
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, good for first time Venice travelers. Decor was very dated, service was not very nice and it will take forever to get to the room its like a maze once you go in, bathroom was ok, very quiet no cleaning ladys making noise before you wake up and breakfast is free.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Steve_64064
Reviews.Content: This old world hotel was right beside the Rialto Bridge. We never had trouble finding out way back! The chandlier was marino glass and georgous. The bath had lots of marble and everything worked great. We had no view, but for the price, we did not expect any. There was a balcony near our room that overlooked the canal. Free breakfast was great. We sat and watched the canal traffic from our table. In all, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for first trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: ashropshirelass78
Reviews.Content: If this is your first time in Venice, this hotel is excellently located. There is a water bus stop right outside & all the lines stop here. Our room (112) didn't overlook the Grand Canal which I was a bit disappointed with to start but on reflection, I think it would have been a bit noisy & our room was lovely & quiet. All staff were very friendly & the breakfast options were varied & plentiful! For an excellent dinner, I recommend Al Vecio Bragosso on the Strada Nova - good wines & waiters too!

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: greekbubble
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and from the outside it looked nice. The location seemed good eventhough the entrance was just by the water taxi station. It was situated just by the Rialto bridge.The reception was bright, modern and quite welcoming. We were then taken to our room. One word for it - oldfashioned. The decor was very dated and the room which was a double standard was small. The bathroom had a shower only. The view from the window as non existant, basically all you could see was another building and nothing else. On the plus side it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideJess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely 4 night stay at this hotel in early January. We walked from Santa Lucia station to the hotel in about 30mins and after checking in, hotel staff assisted us with our bags up to our room. Our room was really nice, beautifully decorated and overlooking a quiet little street which provided us with a quiet night sleep each night. Hotel safe was free and 2 computers in the lobby provided high-speed internet at a small cost. It's in a great location with the Rialto Bridge right on the doorstep. Impossible to get lost, after a day of wandering/sightseeing, you just follow the signs on all the buildings that point you back in the direction of the Rialto Bridge! San Marco square is also only about a 5 min walk away. All staff were really friendly and helpful and provided great tips for sightseeing and recommendations for restaurants etc. Best recommendation was on our last night in Venice when we wanted a memorable dinner, the concierge gave us directions to Poste Vecie, the oldest restaurant in Venice and it was absolutely lovely! Another great thing the hotel provided was a complementary one-way water taxi trip to Murano (the island with the glass factory). The water taxi meter got to 30euro by the time we reached Murano (about a 10min trip) so was great that the hotel picked up that tab! Took a Vaporetta back home which took about 45mins and cost about 5euro each. Breakfast each morning was really nice, lots of different things including cereals, fruit, pastries, juices and lovely fresh tea or coffee. We would definitely recommend this hotel and if we visit Venice again, we'd be very happy to stay at the Rialto Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: NathalieGarino
Reviews.Content: The Rialto Hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of Venice. While our room was fairly small (European standard) and could use a little revamp (Fabric Wall paper is stained due to the heat from heater), the room and bathroom were clean and net. Breakfast was acceptable. A must restaurant/pizzeria to go to, not too far from hotel (concierge recommended it to us) is Antico Panificio where you will eat the best Pizza and the most incredible Tiramisu. Also for the best Lingerie shops, YOU MUST GO to Silvia Venezia where the owner Silvia sells the most incredible Lingerie Pieces (at a price but so gorgeous).

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic view...of the taxi station!”
Reviews.Author: pattyinparis
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location, and selected our room based on its advertised "panoramic view of the Rialto bridge". The only view we had was of the 24-hour water taxi station directly beneath our window. It even blocked out the view of the Grande Canal! As for the Rialto bridge, it was barely visible - only if you fought with the pigeons and leaned off the tiny balcony railing...the bed was comfortable enough and the bathroom facilities were ok, as long as you didn't look into the drainage hole in the floor, which led to the Canal. The hotel has seen better days, and none too recently. Many holes in the carpets in the common areas were covered with duct tape...and there was a pervasive, unpleasant smell to the whole place that no amount of room scent could erase. I would not recommend this hotel, nor would I ever consider staying here again. Breakfast was dismal, with the worst coffee I have ever had outside of a hospital waiting room. Location is not all it is cracked up to be! In addition, avoid Venice at Christmas! If you arrive after the 20th, most concerts, shops and good restaurants are closed. Nobody there but a bunch of unhappy tourists...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: WyattDC
Reviews.Content: Horrible stay. Room smelt of mildew, and there was no A/C. No air condition was not a problem, except that the option of "opening the window" kept us up all night due to nightly noise and sounds of deliveries. Hotel staff was rude, I will never stay or recommend this hotel to anyone. We originally booked this hotel due to location, and that is the only bright spot for this crumbling hotel. Venice is small enough to book something else, and still enjoy the location. Dont do it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovley”
Reviews.Author: Ponkey12321
Reviews.Content: VENICE IS AMAIZING Hotel Rialto is just a couple of metres from the bridge. So great location. Only a short walk from St Marcs Square, and the hotel is just infront of a water taxi service, gondola rides and the main boats. The hotel room i stayed in was hmmm very pink... The walls were a little dirty and small. And the view of the alley was amaizing =P The staff were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Rialto Hotel in Venice is Location”
Reviews.Author: chuTravel
Reviews.Content: For the best location in Venice, it's got to be the Hotel Rialto, just at the foot of the Rialto Bridge. We had a very pleasant stay this past October 2010 with a postcard view from our room #126 of the Bridge and the Grand Canal. Very helpful front desk, especially Marco. Thirty years ago, it was our honeymoon hotel. Anita and Fred Chu.

Reviews.Title: “Well sited but middling facility.”
Reviews.Author: Jannerbloke
