Reviews.Content: Right by the Rialto Bridge and about 100m from the stop for the waterbus from Marco Polo this place suited us well. The deal including a basic buffet breakfast was good value but the room was smallish, the bathroom while well put together was compact and had only a shower which was disappointing after long walks. The reception is busy at most times so with the old 'hand in and collect your key' system we often had to wait ten or fifteen minutes and also felt that since there was no recognition or identity check the security in the room was poor. The lift only covered part of the building and we were routinely confronted with three flights of stairs. The TV had BBCW blocked, but we had a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Potty41
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£500 for 3 nights in November. The Suite we booked overlooked the Grand Canal but was a bit tired and scruffy. We asked for another room and the staff couldnt be more helpful and we were instantly moved to a seperate building to a room which had been modernised and gave you a real feel for the old Venice. We had a great view and the room was really clean. The reception staff were always extremely helpful and we couldnt fault them. This is ideally situated on the Rialto Bridge and everywhere in Venice is walkable from here and it is right on the Rialto Water Bus stop so no carrying luggage for miles down narrow streets and over bridges. Down side no tea or coffee in rooms and only have Italian TV stations. Otherwise fab.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: varroom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of all that is going on in Venice, then this might be the one for you. But be careful to confirm the type of room that you will be assigned as that will make the difference between a pleasant stay or a bad experience. We booked a junior suite with a request for a canal view, but on arrival we were led along a maze of corridors to a dingy room in the rear with a view of the alleyway. Fortunately the friendly front desk staff were able to move us the next day to a very nicely furnished room with a view of the canal. It was really a treat to open the shutters and see that fabulous view. The buffet breakfast was quite good and could be taken inside or outside on the canal terrace, which was nice. This hotel is located in a very busy area with constant water traffic and lots of people walking by. Very central to everything, but not for those seeking a quiet spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChefAK
Reviews.Content: It was clean, close access to St. Marks Square and almost on top of the Rialto bridge. BUT...not a four star hotel. Old and tired, I can handle but the shower was usless almost. The shower stall was 30 inches by 30 inches and maybe even smaller. It was impossibl to get a good shower! Do not accept the free water taxi ride to Murano from the hotel. We were a captured audience. It was like someone trying to sell us a condo! As soon as they heard we were from the US you would think we had money growing out of our ears. They really would not leave us alone with their constant sales pitch. Very annoying. Still, i would reccoemnd the hotel for its location.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad mildew”
Reviews.Author: TexasNativetx
Reviews.Content: While the location of the hotel is great since there are signs everywhere pointing you to the Rialto Bridge, the accomdations leave something to be desired. Our room was located across the alley in a neighboring apartment building. We climbed a set of stairs ( beware of the one step that is shorter than the rest), and down a hallway. When we opened the door to the room, I knew we were in trouble. While the actual room was not bad, I was overcome with the smell of mildew. I figured we would not be in the room but just to sleep. But sure enough, I woke up the next morning sick. The problem is that the shower door is tricky and does not close properly, leaving water to flow all over the bathroom floor and into the carpet. From what I understand, the room was larger than most hotel rooms in Venice, but I would have traded a smaller room for my health any day. Also, do not use the lobby bathroom ( by the restaurant). This was quite possibly the dirtiest restroom I encountered in Europe. There were feces smeared accross the wall. Gross!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lesley255060
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a three night stay at the Rialto and cant recommend it highly enough. The service we received at the desk on arrival was really pleasant, the guys made us feel very welcome and on entry to our room were amazed at the spaciousness of it plus the view over the main canal was something to behold. The breakfast was quite sufficient and u could order a full breakfast on request. We were really sorry to leave and look forward to going back again in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mykika
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for canal side rooms and loved them. There was always something going on and the noise didn't bother us. Breakfast was in front of hotel right by bridge, good continental breakfast but you must watch the pigeons. Evening meal overpriced but self service next door run by hotel gives 10% off for guests and more reasonable. Small viewing place a nice outside space but not easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled at all!”
Reviews.Author: Katenac
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a room which was off a back alley. While standing in this alley you had to wait to be "buzzed in" by the front desk. I was with my daughter and didn't feel safe at all. When we requested a different room they very rudely told us that's all they had. Once you were buzzed in, we had to climb up very steep steps (about 35 steps). It's impossible to carry your luggage up the narrow steps. You definitely need a busboy to do this for you. The room was smaller and older. But honestly I could have dealt with all of that if the hotel people weren't so darn mean. Internet was supposedly free in the lobby. We couldn't get it to work at all and the hotel receptionist was very obnoxious when we asked for help. Truthfully I would have left after one night and gone on to our next stop if I could have.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MLSTRICK
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room with Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge views. Surprise to us we received the only room in the hotel - Room 408 - with both views from our balcony. It was the most awesome view of any hotel I have ever stayed at. Front desk staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, perfect location and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: EntreNous41
Reviews.Content: Breakfasts left a lot to be desired. Coffee awful. Other than that it was clean, large rooms and comfortable and so close to everything, right on the water with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great hotel, however....”
Reviews.Author: olivierp2008
Reviews.Content: certainely one of the most populated area in Venice (beside St Marco Place), the rialto hotel is located right at the first step of the Rialto bridge which is one of the main attraction in Venice. Also, surrounded by excellent restaurant all around and public transportation right in front of the hotel. Very easy to communite from and to the airport. As far as the hotel goes, the rooms are very clean. We had a junior suite, which i find it small and cannot imagine what a regular size bedroom would be like. The bed was very confortable and the hotel very quiet. The downside...the room are very old....decoration has not been changed since probably the past 20 years! Style is very italian and roccocco!... TV is very old, and most channels are Italian....very limited english speaking channel. The staff is not the most friendly in a sense that you really need to ask the right question to get the info you need. As far as breakfast goes, it is very good and lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Alistair310
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our agent in Australia. Subsequently noticed some negative reviews on TripAdvisor. However they were balanced by positives. I can only say that our experience was outstanding. The hotel staff were 100% helpful, our room, a Junior Suite overlooking the Grand Canal, was extremely comfortable, beautifully decorated, and scrupulously clean. The location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: alisonandjohnrichard
Reviews.Content: my partner and i have just come back from our holiday in venice , and we stayed at the Rialto . We had read a lot of negative comments on this hotel , so i was a bit nervous when flying over , but when we arrived , the hotel was fantastic . Our room was in the main part of the hotel , rm 112 , the panoramic terrace was along the other part of the hotel . We had rung the hotel up and requested a room with a shower which we got , our room was big , bigger than what i thought , although our window had no view , it was quiet which was nice . The air con was quiet , it had a safe , but the only negative thing was the hairdryer ! ladies , take your own . The breakfast was lovely , if you booked a room with breakfast , it was no extra , lots to choose from , cereal , friut , eggs , criossants , doughnuts , cheese, ham , salami and bread . The location was second to none , 10 mins to Doges palace and the Sqaure, perfect . Venice is not cheap though , an evening meal with a couple of beers , with no sweet was about 50-60 euors !!!!! From the airport , walk to the public transport and get the ORANGE ALILAGUNA , 13 euros , a private water taxi is 95 euros , the stop is 50 yards from the hotel to .We would def go back there if we went again .

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Venice Location!”
Reviews.Author: aliandjohncumbria
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 5 nights at the beginning of September, the hotel is perfectly situated for all of the sights of Venice. I called ahead of our stay to make sure we had a shower as that's what we prefer and they gave us a room with a great big shower cubicle (112) which had great hot water throughout the day. It wasn't a huge room but big enough for a base, the bed was a king size and very comfortable. There is a safe in the room which is easy to use. We didn't have any view to speak of but the hotel has a roof terrace available to all guests which views over the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge, much better than being in the room and it didn't get that busy either! a nice way to finish off the evening. Breakfast was ace! You had to pay a bit more for cooked but the continental was as much as you like, pastries are a great start to the holiday day :-) Piazza San Marco is a 10 minute walk behind the hotel where some of the must do sights are, you are right near the shopping district too if that's your thing. There is a public water stop outside the hotel with access to the airport (it really is very easy!) the best way to see Venice by water is using the public boat service. get a travel pass, again right outside the Hotel. We were very happy with our stay here, the staff were always polite and friendly, the housekeeping was to a very high standard and we will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: marylou924
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is a plus for Venice. Upon arrival, the hotel lobby presents a false impression of the upper levels. For starters, the frayed and dusty rugs hit you while climbing the stairs to the 3rd floor. Now we get to the room, and exposed to a musty smell and cigarettes. The stains in the mattress caused my family and friends to check out. It was a dark room, with out dated French Provincial furniture and walls covered in a silk. (hit it and all this dust flies around the room)

Reviews.Title: “Great base, good quality - more good points than bad.”
Reviews.Author: spurst0tty
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Rialto for our 25th Wedding Anniversary, so we wanted something a bit special. Not being flushed with money I booked a double room, but one with a view of the Rialto Bridge. The location of the hotel is perfect, right next to the Rialto Bridge, and next to water bus stops, (which really did not interfere with our sleep or enjoyment as much as you would imagine). On our arrival we were more than happy with our choice. The room had a balcony, with the kind of view I had only dreampt of, which was great to sit on with a glass of the complementary sparkling wine which we were given (as it was our anniversary - as stated on their web-site), and was great for people watching when my feet couldn't walk any longer! The room had all the amenities which you actually need from a hotel, and the 'period style' furniture was a nice touch, although it could really do with a bit of Tender Loving Care now, as the decor is beginning to look a bit 'tired'. The mini-bar (although not used by us) was well stocked and was reasonably priced for such a location, the bathroom clean and the shower hot and powerful whatever time of day...the hairdryer could have been a bit more powerful, but worked ok nonetheless. The Consierge, reception, maid service, porters, and breakfast staff were very polite and helpful, and although some reviews knock the buffet breakfast, just how much do you need to eat?? A variety of pastries, cold meats, bread, cheese, yogurt, eggs, cereal, fruit, juices, coffee...need I go on..? We found the front line staff very helpful, unlike other reviews which I had read prior to our stay, and they arranged tickets for us to a Vivaldi concert, and offered other services with no fuss or bother. On the first night we ate at the restaurant attached to the Hotel...mainly because we were given a 10% discount, and found this to be of exceptional quality, so don't be put off. All in all I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to a friend, although if any of their staff read these reviews, just a bit of decorating here and there would be good, and please, please, although our balcony was a bonus - room 124 - please, a lick of fresh paint or even some new ironwork on the balcony railings would make all the difference. All in all a good stay, in a fair hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “NEARLY NO AIR CONDITIONING - Extremely disappointing stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeW58
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms in this hotel for a post cruise stay. The hotel's location is great but that is where an exceptional rating ends. I booked and prepaid for a double for my husband and me and a triple suite for our three children. We were given a triple but the room was NOT a suite. It was a standard size room with a queen bed and a small twin cot like bed in the corner. There was so little space in this "suite" that I had to put some of my children's luggage in my room. Don't forget, I paid for a suite to avoid this problem. Our rooms were located four floors up but the elevator only goes to the second floor. Walking up and down two flights of stairs is a problem for me as I have arthritis. I saw nothing on this hotel's website regarding the lack of an elevator. But the worse part of the stay was the nearly non existant air conditioning. It was very hot and humid in Venice during our stay. Imagine returning to your hotel hot and tired after touring for hours in the heat only to find the hotel room without air conditioning. When I called the front desk to complain, I was told "sorry there is nothing we can do. It is hot in Venice." The only way to cool off was to take a long cold shower! If you are considering this hotel, my advice is to keep looking!!! The good location is not enough to overcome the extreme negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location to experience Venice!”
Reviews.Author: meebjt
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times, and have yet to be let down by the great service, location and atmosphere. It is in the heart of everything you want to experience as a tourist, and finds the perfect balance of product and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: GS_VA12
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rialto is very centrally located on the Grand Canal in Venice. It is easy to get to by water taxi or shuttle. We reserved two rooms -- one for our three children and one for us. Our initial room was one of the worst hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. It smelled like smoke. When I complained to the bellman, he insisted that there is no smoking in the hotel and returned with a bottle of Glade air freshener. When we returned to the hotel in the evening, the smell was so bad that we spoke to the front desk. Unfortunately, the hotel was full and they could not provide another room. Even worse was the rude and dismissive manner of the front desk person. The smoke smell was so persistent that I suspect the smell was not from a guest but from some part of the air circulation system. Also, the bathroom in the room was so small that an adult could not sit on the commode because the shower was so close (imagine sitting "side saddle"). The shower was so small that I could not put up my arms to wash my hair. Fortunately, in the morning the person at the front desk was much better at customer service and provided us with another room. This room did not smell of smoke and had a traditionally arranged bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for first time visit , but not for light sleepers, skip breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Hadrian_ex
Reviews.Content: As many others have said, the Hotel Rialto is perfectly positioned and if location is your priorty (it was mine) and you mainly want somewhere to lay your head, I would recommend this hotel. It is the centre of Venice, and right on the Grand Canal. This means that it is ideal for arriving from the airport by water (very easy to find and it has it's own landing point) and is 30 seconds from a vaporreto stop (water buses) that will take you close to anywhere in Venice. If you prefer to explore on foot, you can walk to San Marco in about 10 minutes or stroll across the famous Rialto bridge and explore the other side (I recommend the Frari as the most interesting place we visited. The room was on the small side. I imagine this is the case with all Venetian hotels as all the buildings are crammed together. We were at the back of the hotel and the streets outside were always busy, but the windows blocked the noise out very well once closed. More of a problem was that there was just a thin partition wall between us and the room next door and one night we could hear the person next door snoring very loudly; that made it difficult for us to sleep. We'd included a breakfast buffet at the hotel as I had heard how expensive Venice was and planned to eat well at breakfast and skip lunch. However the breakfast buffet was a disappointment and if I went again I wouldn't pay extra for breakfast at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a View”
Reviews.Author: RobertAries
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rialto is at the foot of the Ponte de Rialto in Venice, IT. Pricey, but the view is like no other. The Ponte de Rialto bridge is famous for its achitecture and is the most traveled foot bridge in Venice. You can sit on the hotels restaraunt outdoor patio or the upstair hotel viewing balcony and catch a view of the entire Grand Canal and the Ponte de Rialto. The rooms were small, but all of Venice they are. The service and information desk were the best. English speaking and more than willing to find restaraunts and setup water taxi's back to the airport (that's the only way to go for the price and time). Always, and I can't stress this enough, USE RICK STEVES book on Venice for Hotels and restaraunts!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Room in the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boris86
Reviews.Content: We got in late after flying in from Nalpes. The night desk were shockingly rude and indifferent. We got put in the smallest, furtherst, darkest room in the hotel. It was late, so in the morning we asked for a better room, even if we had to pay more. We got shown another grotty room, until finally we got a small but clean room close to the front door and a window that opened. To be fair this is a typical 3 star job for Italy. On the plus side its location was good, but then nothing is that far away in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyment depends on which room you're allocated!”
Reviews.Author: mozfather
Reviews.Content: The very best thing about The Rialto is the location. It's within walking distance of many of the places of interest, and the Vapparetto stop's right outside if you're going further afield. After watching many tourists wandering around the narrow alleys with their suitcases, trying to work out on the map where their hotel was, I was glad I based my choice on location. The hotel itself is actually five long, narrow buildings joined together, which makes it a bit of a rabbit warren inside. If your lucky enough to get a front or side facing room, as we did, then it's great, always something or someone to look at and you feel part of the place, but unfortunately, for every front facing room, there's one facing the back alley, with a wall about 3 feet from your window, as we found out when we walked around the back of the hotel. So it's the luck of the draw really! Our room was small, but fine for what we needed and very clean. The breakfast was ok, nothing special. The choice was a bit limited and the breakfast room tiny for the amount of people who must stay there, but it was better if you got down earlier, before 8.30. Venice is a very expensive place so for a couple of nights we bought some food from the local supermarket and ate it up on their roof terrace, which was lovely and no one there but us! I'd recommend this hotel on our own personal experience, but, as I said, someone else's may be entirely different. Try to get a front facing room and you should be ok. Make sure you cross over the bridge and walk through the market and the streets on the other side,there's a great atmosphere over there, and not quite so many tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, thats about it.”
Reviews.Author: W0ntStayH0me
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisers contributors recommendation of the great location which was accurate. The hotel is just at the Rialto bridge and as been said by others it is only a ten minute walk to San Marco. Plenty of busy streets roundabout for nice shopping and didnt have to go too far for good but overpriced food in the evening. However this hotel is solely about location. Booked Grand Canal view room and was surprised to be shown to our room at 10.30am having just gotten off a cruise ship. Surprise turned to shock when I opened the curtains to see our Grand Canal view totally obscured by the Vaparetto station right slap bang in front of our room. The Vaparetto bangs into the station on its arrival every ten minutes or so and I doubt that the dead could have slept in that room plus no view of canal!. Went downstairs to reception and acted all girly and pathetic and got room changed to one with good view of the bridge and the canal as paid for. Pleasant smiley gent at reception was thus helpful but he seemed only to be about in the mornings. Other than that it was a battle of wills to get your key from reception and anything else you needed. As my husband said we have been patronised in much better establishments than this. New room with the good view was otherwise clean but very tired. Mini bar was ok and good shower strength in the bathroom. Shutters on the windows allowed us to sleep as boat life on the canal was pretty much 24hrs a day. Noticed a room from the outside which had small balcony with two seats and table which would be worth asking for. Good luck. Breakfast room was small, cramped and the food was nondescript. Breakfast staff must have trained at the Lord Snooty school of hospitality. Had to use the ladies loo just off the foyer before departing and sorry guys thought I had strayed into the gents, disgusting. Glad I had a roll of loo paper in my handbag. This toilet did service the cafe attached to the front of the hotel and was therefore used by the cafe patrons also but none the less not good. So regrettably although the location was good, at just over 300 Euros per night I would have expected a bedroom that had been redecorated in the past twenty years. Venice is a totally unique experience but will I be back? Not to the Rialto Hotel and probably not to Venice either. Overpriced and chock a block with people. See Venice and die. Quite possibly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - although i wish i stayed in it!”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: Obviously being right outside the Rialto Bridge is great and only a 10 minute walk to St Mark's Sq is a perfect location. At the advise of our travel agent we paid 50 euro in a private water taxi to get there from St Lucia Train station which was a waste of money as we could have paid a few euro each on a water bus line which drops you right outside the hotel. We paid for a run of the house room and were expecting a small, run down room but instead we had a large room (about 50 sq meters in total) with large bathroom and even a private courtyard. Although getting to the room was weird and we were jelous of everyone else using the lift. We had to walk thru the lobby, thru the restaurant, out a back door, accross a courtyard into another building and up 50 stairs and thru another hall way to get to our room. That didn't bother us much as it was the experience of Venice although when we checked out no one was able to come and collect our luggage and we had to carry it down ourselves. Downsides to the hotel were that not all staff spoke English, Breakfast was pointless with their minimal selection and the tiny TV in the room and we couldnt get any English speaking Channels. No room service is offered but the restaurant out the front was really good and you get a 10% discount if you are staying in the hotel. If it wasn't for the location or the fact we got a large room I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel but if you're lucky enough to get a big room (in the hotel, not the out-house) I would imagine it would be a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, let down by facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: athegrate
Reviews.Content: Central location very near to Rialto Bridge on the Grand Canal. Unfortunately let down by facilities - small rooms and antiquated equipment. Electricity supply is not reliable if using own equipment - trips out very easily. Lack of power points to charge mobile phones etc. No internet access in rooms. Problems receiving some TV channels. Front desk was generally very helpful but breakfast staff generally surly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithsmallgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - adjacent to the Ponte Rialto and near the vaporetti stops at Rialto and Mercato Rialto. Walking distance to Saint Marks, and within yards of some good restaurants and great bars. Our room was a little weird - out the back of the lobby, down an alley and then up a flight of stairs in another building. But really, isn't most of Venice "down an alley"? Once we were in the room, we found a two room suite, with a separate full bed for my 9-year old daughter. The windows opened onto the alley, but it was quiet at night, much quieter than a room at the front of the house would have been. The Icelandic vocano disrupted our travel plans, and that's when I really started to like the staff. They were polite and accomodating as we tried to rearrange flights to get back to the States. We checked out once, went to the airport and found our flight cancelled. We returned to the hotel and they gave us our room back at the same rate. I asked for the room for two more nights, and then found a flight from Rome, so we left the netx morning. Not a peep from the desk - he said he was happy we had found a flight. The hotel also made extra efforts to make sure we had access to computers as we juggled flight schedules; even waiving the posted Internet access fees. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off !!”
Reviews.Author: FozzoNorthWales
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at Venice airport on the 6th April, my instant interpretation of Venice, to take as much money as possible and give as little in return as possible !! We arrived by water taxi at the Rialto Hotel and where shown to our junior suite ?? What a joke, overlooking the back alley, bed like a stone slab !! very shabby and no shower, a bath with a mixer tap !! Awfull ! The breakfast was a insult, tinned fresh fruit salad, processed orange juice, tiny bread rolls, boiled eggs extra,any cooked part was extra, the tables where crushed together and the cheese and ham, salami offered was cheap and tasteless !! The food in the whole of Venice was overpriced and all rubbish, pizza and panini in abundance, what a total rip off, and dont even go to Harry`s bar 35 euro for 2 fizzi peach juice, served by dick turpin in a white coat ! Wales is heaven !!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rialto - Ripped Me Off”
Reviews.Author: World-Traveler10001
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rialto (Venice) refused to re-schedule or refund (even partially) a pre-booked eight night stay in there hotel after ALL UK flights from the UK had been grounded because of the volcanic ash drifting across Europe. A situation out of anyone's control. BEWARE of the NON-REFUND policy - Hotel Rialto does enforce this policy â€“ NO EXCUSES. I have lost over Â£2000 for this booking. I believe this is very unfair given the genuine reasoning for re-scheduling.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But.......”
Reviews.Author: Wadester2u
Reviews.Content: First the pros: The Hotel Rialto is in the heart of Venice, right next to the Rialto Bridge. It's in an excellent location, perfect for exploring and shopping. However, if you want an american sized room, pay for an upgrated room at the time of booking, or you will NOT good a decent sized room. We rent on an Experdia package that we threw together, and just paid for the Run Of House room. We were given a tiny-sized room that was two flights above the 2nd floor elevator stop, meaning you lug your tail up two flights with no stairs. We complained and complained and were finally offered a different room t wo days, but it was just as tiny as the one we had, so we did not switch. If you go with just the "Run Of House" price at booking, you will NOT get a room with a view, and will NOT get a room that's any bigger for you to barely walk around the bed. We got over it however, after a couple of days. We spend the majority of time walking all over the city, and only used the room to hit the bed at night. The included breakfast was fair; assorted rolls, sliced prociutto ham, sliced salami and hard-boiled eggs. If you want scrambled or made-to-order egss however, that is an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good room with view”
Reviews.Author: TooLateDave
Reviews.Content: Good central location right by the Rialto bridge. We upgraded to a room with canal view, which was excellent - a good size with two big windows giving a superb view over the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal. The service was friendly and efficient, and the breakfast was fine, offering a wide range of cereal, fruit, bread and cold cheese and meat. Some people might find the location a little noisy, as small goods boats unload at Rialto during the night, but this didn't bother us. Our friends had a non-canal-view room, which was much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lavajelly
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a weekend get-away special on lastminute with a limited budget so I was not expecting much. I was so surprised. It was an excellent hotel and just what we wanted for a weekend in Venice. The rooms are done out Venetian style. Flamboyant with upholstered wall coverings and very ornamental glass light fittings. The furnishing is well used. Not worn out and scruffy but you can see that a lot of people pass through their doors. It did not ruin the comfort or the experience and in a city this old it suits the atmosphere. My partner and I loved the room we were in. It was very clean, the bathrooms were marbled and well maintained. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is also very good. Some of the best value for money (in Venice terms) restaurants are on the other side of the bridge. Cross over the bridge and first turn right. Great view of the canal however you must book. We had excellent meals (something you don't get often in Venice) at decent prices (still expensive approx Â£90 with wine, starter main). Go close to St Marks and the same will cost twice as much. The best part of the hotel was the terrace. Others have mentioned it. It has an excellent view of the Grand Canal and the Rialto bridge. The best part is you can take your own drinks up there and sit and enjoy the activity going on down below. Most evenings we bought a bottle of wine from the wine shop around the corner and sat there until after 12pm. On the negative side - the breakfast room is small. We had breakfast there one morning and found it cramped. However it is adequate although I would skip it next time. I would certainly go back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: molliecat
Reviews.Content: Just back from five days in Venice,have seen many reviews about the Rialto Hotel and it's a good job we took no notice of the last one we read. Hotel location is perfect our room did not have a canal view but we knew that, the room was lovely plenty of room ,bathroon roomy and spotless. The man on reception was lovely nothing was to much trouble breakfast was the normal but always fresh and kept filled. We had snow when we got there which made Venice so special and then the next morning blue sky and everyday after so all in all a wonderfull holiday so if you want a nice hotel we would have know problem going to the Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but terrible rooms. will not return”
Reviews.Author: knitgusknit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Grand Canal in the heart of Venice. But, altho the rooms were clean, they were old, musty with water stained wall coverings, thin bare carpet. The rooms smelled moldz. Room was small, cramped, uncomfortable. It is decorated in the Venitian style, but desparetly needs updated. Bathrom was cramped. you couldnt even turn around. We had 3 people and my daughter got a cot with a worn out mattress. The first desk clerk acted surley, like he was doing us a favor to check us in. The others were pleasant. The american breakfast was OK. It is the typical Italian breakfast buffet, but having stayed in other It hotels, this one was not up to par. Fruit cocktail instead of fresh fruit, poor quality meats and cheeses. We were unfortunate in that it snowed so we missed most of what Venice if famous for ' the beautiful streets, etc. We want to come back and see the city in the summer, but we will never stay at this hotel again. Do not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect get away”
Reviews.Author: carlosinmiami
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a treat. Very easy to access, take vaporetto #2 from train station to the Rialto bridge, presto you're there. Splurge and get a room with a canal view, no need for balcony, they are too small, you really can't walk out on them. We had two windows that opened up and had a ledge, enough to sit on & have a glass of wine while you take in the view. Staff was friendly, room was very large for euro standards. Bath with tub, another treat. I would stay here anytime. Great for romantic moments.

Reviews.Title: “Mean Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marron222
Reviews.Content: Having read so many negative reviews I only decided to book at the Rialto for the location, and having a room overlooking the bridge was wonderful. I even enjoyed the noise from the canal traffic.The breakfast though was the meanest and poorest breakfast Ive had for years. Many other reviewers found the staff rude. I found most of them very courteous except for a pair of men who seemed totally oblivious of the guests' needs. Once they left us waiting by the lift door for five minutes without telling us it was being repaired. Another time we reported seeing a man walk out of our room and they just commented that"it's so strange" We didnt know whether to laugh or cry. Over all Id still go again as you can feel the soul of Venice from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Charleyandwill
Reviews.Content: You'd be hard pushed to get a better location than this. Overlooking the Rialto bridge, which is wonderful to see at all times of day or night. There are many reteraunts nearby & a bus stop outside to catch the water buses. Staff were corteous & friendly, very helpful with information & directions, we found them very efficient. The room was sweet, a little kitsch, but made us smile. Good value for money for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disapointing!”
Reviews.Author: SamH-W
Reviews.Content: I had great expectations of this hotel after recieving a rave review from the local tourist information centre. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a none too freindly female receptionist who seemed more interested in a phone call, from whome I can only assume was from her Italian stallion boyfriend or at least her lustual phone manager gave this suggestion. After finally getting checked in and locating our room, which was exceptionally well furnished and had an excuisite bathroom, I was rather annoyed to find that our river view was actually a stone courtyard. I immediately requested to be moved to a room with a view but was told that this was not an option and had apparently not been agreed upon with the tourist information centre who had made the booking. My partner and I decided we were too tired too argue and that we would make the most of a good nights sleep before enjoying a full days sightseeing. Although the beds were comfortable our good nights sleep was interupted by lots noise from some very loud people and vehicles coming from the courtyard. The hotels breakfast room was small, cramped and unfurtanetely seemed to be inhabited by a group of loud mouthed Germans and some extremely bad mannered American guests who were as equally unhappy as we were about the breakfast which consisted of stale pastries and cereal. After breakfast we decided enough was enough and that we would try our luck elsewhere! All in all, I would say the hotel has potential, the location was perfect for exploring the city and the decor was exceptionally good, unfortunately it was let down by unprofessional staff and a chef who would be more suited to a cartain hotel in Torquay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: llukk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rialto hotel with my husband and friends during Dec, 2009. Its a very very clean hotel, the staff are nice and almost all of them can communicate in English. Although the room was small and not overlooking the canal, it was very clean and the room serivce was gr8. The location is very city center and you can access almost the whole city from the hotel, there is a boat station 100m from the hotel (may be less). The breakfast was good, not too many varaities but it was nice and well presented. I would advice to not go to venice during winter as it was extermely cold and whether snowing or rainning!!!! I would like to visit Venice again but may be in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, rude staff but best location in Venize”
Reviews.Author: cocotte86
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but furnished with nice authentic venitian furniture. When we arrived with all our luggages nobody from the staff came to help us at the front door, we had to carry everything by ourselve to the reception desk and fight with the door which was closing on us. When they had make sure we really had a reservation, they finally started to help us with the luggage ! This gave the tone for the rest for our stay. The staff was pretty rude and distant. The breakfast was nice. The location of the hotel is nice, straight on the grand canal, you don't have to carry all your luggage in the streets when you get off the boat...

Reviews.Title: “Met with the worst reception ever!!”
Reviews.Author: bella711
Reviews.Content: I was on a holiday with my elderly parents. We had just arrived in Venice after quite a journey and was simple looking forward to check in the hotel and walk around beautiful Venice. But we were met with the rudest male receptionist ever. We requested for a room facing the bridge, but due to communication breakdown or language problem, we were not sure of what he was saying. So we requested again, and he simple replied no, you can leave. He said three times he told us can't and we didnt get it so leave the hotel. We had paid already and he said he did not care and told us to leave and called my mother crazy, a senior citizen who was trying to understand what he was saying. He refused to check us in and we asked for someone else but there was no one. I could not believe this was happening. We were shocked. He treated us women like garbage and was throwing us out. We were visitors, we could not do anything at that point. Go where? So we had to plead with him while he showed absolute disregard and attitude to us. Throughout our stay we were met with such rude and despicable behaviour, he knowing we couldnt do anything about it. This person needs to be fired and i plan to pursue this further. Hotel location is good, but with a staff like that, its just unimaginable how we made it through staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Frostie716
Reviews.Content: The Rialto is the perfect hotel in Venice. Ten steps from the valporetto stop, close to restaurants and shopping, only a ten minute walk to Piazza San Marco through the most beautiful shopping district. The rooms were great and the staff was very helpful. A very good value!!!!! Do yourself a favor, especially on yoour first trip to Venice......stay at the Ralto!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Overated”
Reviews.Author: Smithyx
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd hotel in a 2 month visit to Europe and I have decided to review each one in a in a standard way as suggested by Tripadviser. We stayed here for 3 nights. 1: Describe the service you experienced. The check in and out was easy and efficient the reception staff organising our bags to be taken to our room. On the other times we had to ask questions about getting around and such they reception guys were helpful and gave us a map to get around. 2: Tell us how you liked the room The room tiny with barley enough room to walk beside the bed, and once you got your bag set up there was even less room. The room decor was old and tired and whilst not being that bad and not really affecting our time there it just needs a general upgrade I think, this was one of the most expensive hotels we stayed in on our trip so it was a little disappointing to say the least. Housekeeping was efficient and the room was cleaned as usual each day. 3: Talk about the location & amenities Breakfast was served in the restaurant attached to the hotel downstairs, which can be a bit noisy as its right on the main tourist spot the Rialto Bridge. Breakfast was very disappointing with only some cereal, a choice of ham and salami with bread roles and a few pieces of fruit and yoghurt and that was it. As said previously the location is prime, basically on the steps of the Rialto bridge, this is a very central location to be in Venice and as we walked everywhere around the towns it was an easy place to get back to. We didnâ€™t get a gondola ride as even though we were in Venice for the 1st time and would probably never go back 150 Euro was too expensive so we just used the ferry service which was excellent. Internet access was cheap but again only 1 pc made getting online difficult. 4: Say what you liked best & least We loved the location of this hotel, right at the ferry stop from the train station but honestly its all it has going for it, for the price they charged it really is a very basic joint and honestly I think the hotels in the back street would be much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Will be going again !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jnics03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rialto Hotel during our first trip to Venice. It was the perfect location after a long day walking around Venice it was easy to find the hotel. The hotel itself was lovely, we had a suite at the side of the hotel and I must abmit the street noise was minimal with the shutters closed. The breakfast was plentiful with a choice of breads/pastries/meats etc which set us up for the walking !!!. We would definately go back and can't think of a more beautiful city to visit..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rialto was our pick and we loved being on the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: letsgo27
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I arrived by train & then took the Vaparetto right to the door of the Rialto Hotel. Although our room was small, the furnishings were just what we needed. When only in the room at night, the size of it does not matter. The front desk staff was very attentive & helpful, especially when infomring us which direction to head for dinner as many places are closed in January. The breakfast had plenty to choose from so we only had lunch & dinner to find later. When walking about, signs were everywhere directing us back to The Rialto. Of course we did get lost, but never felt unsafe with the signs so helpful. Our room did not have a view of the canal, but I loved hearing the sounds of Venice coming to life in the mornings. The wonderful view from the Rialto Bridge was just steps away & it was easy to make it to the many attractions. We used a water taxi to get us to the airport & were picked up right in front of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: callelofgren
Reviews.Content: It was perfect for our wedding. I will be there again in 2 years but not in the weddingsuite i guess. Small and clean.

Reviews.Title: “An extra surprise!”
Reviews.Author: AverageGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite canal view room in September 09 for 2 nights. Our windows opened right up and you had a great view of the canal and the Rialto Bridge. Other reviews complain about the noise but we didn't experience this at all. If you have the window closed, and the air conditioner is going, you can't hear anything from outside. You can however hear the noise with the window open - but this is what you want isn't it? You want to soak up the atmosphere of Venice and of one of the most famous bridges in the world! The decor is Venetian, and although very dated, it is clean and functional. The staff are pleasant and courteous but that's about it. Buffet breakfast was a bit of a disaster with empty platters, empty juice jugs, no glasses, no spoons etc. You have to constantly ask for the food and cutlery to be filled up. If the hotel was not located where it was you wouldn't get people going back, especially at the prices they charge! The hotel is certainly in an excellent location, and only a few minutes walk to St Marks with plenty of delightful shops, piazzas and bridges along the way. It's the view and location that attract people to that hotel. But the big surprise we found at the hotel was the beautiful terrace overlooking the canal with tables and umbrellas where you could relax with a few drinks or a good book! Just follow the signs to the Panoramic Terrace, but before you do grab a bottle of Prosecco from the local supermarket just a few streets away (just 3 euro!!) and a few nibblies, and spend the night watching the traffic go by! Oh, and beware of the "free" boat trip to Murano. The hotel arranges a private water taxi to take you to the island and then a gallery representative escorts you to watch some glass blowing, then you view the glass works in the gallery and are encouraged to buy. If you don't buy, you're out the dorr and you have to make your own way back to the hotel at your own cost!! They don't explain this part to you at reception!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Ladydriver
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend of 18/19/20 September at this hotel, a group of 8 of us from Ireland celebrating my 60th birthday. My family had arranged for my husband and myself to be upgraded and we had the most amazing junior suite on a corner, with one window looking right at the Rialto Bridge, and the other two overlooking the canal. The room was lovely with a big bed, and was well serviced every day, with the bed turned down and towels renewed at night. Other reviews on here mention the noise in canal view rooms, but the airconditioning is so efficient and quiet that you can leave it on at night, keep the windows closed, and you will hear virtually nothing. Staff were friendly, the reception staff were most helpful at all times. The hotel bar is expensive, but after all, it is right beside the Rialto Bridge - on Sunday evening, we met another couple and sat right under the bridge. Gradually other people joined us, and it was no problem to the waiter to find extra chairs and take our different orders. Other members of our party had very nice rooms too, each one different, but everything spotlessly clean. Breakfast was plentiful, fruit, lovely juice, boiled eggs, rolls etc. We were delighted we chose this hotel, it was on the advice of a friend who had been there before.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is of two star quality with poor service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Emeraldilex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely lacking in four star quality. Attitude of waiting staff was appalling, buffet breakfast was even worse. At one time in the restaurant we were told by a waitress to "Just Sit Down". Room was poor in quality, size and looked out onto dubious alleyway with brick wall to look at. It has no pleasant bar to sit and relax with a drink unless you wish to share the facilities with passing public and the restaurant is in fact also the one used for the public on the street. It is shabby, low quality and should be re-graded to a Two Star. The first room we were offered on arrival was out of side door of hotel onto dirty alleyway and then into a big old door with no inside access to main hotel. We were offered a key to this door in alleyway to gain access to our room. We rejected this and were given a small inadequate room in main hotel. Overall opinion is this hotel is very, very bad and not recommended in any way at all.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: edwardstwo
Reviews.Content: we received a very warm welcome on arrival and were made to feel welcome throughout our entire stay. the hotel could not be in a better position, right next to the Rialto bridge, and only 5 mins walk from San Marco. We stayed for 3 nights and walked everywhere, you can get around with ease, yes it is easy to get lost but also easy to find your way again and thats part of the fun. As we went with friends who were celerbrating a birthday milestone we chose to splash out a little and go for a room with a view of Grand Canal, the room was kept very clean and replenished everyday. We had a wonderful view with Rialto Bridge on the right and the Grand Canal winding away to the left, our friends had the room next door with three windows all with great views and a small balconly big enrough to sit 2 people with space.,Our room numbers 408 and 409. Yes there was some noise but it was only talking and laughing no music club noise or rowdy ness, the vaporettos could be heard when moveing off but we did not hear them early, they seems to start about 8 o'clock, but when you closed the windows it was very quiet if you need to have a lay in. There was a roof top terrace for use by the guests but as our rooms had lovely views we had no need to use it but we had a peek and it was very pleasant with a good view. We would certainly go back to the same hotel on another visit. thouroughly memorable experiance. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: dcvoyagerDc
Reviews.Content: Great location - only 10 minutes from St. Mark's Basilica Staff knowledgeable and spoke English as well as French Rooms *are* tiny, but well-decorated in the Venetian style and clean Definitely plan to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and next to Water Bus stop”
Reviews.Author: alanpinchard
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in July, booked the honeymoon junior suite with canal view (apparently there are three of these!) got a room (128) with two little balconies right above the Water bus stop (vaporetti) it was great for watching the world go by, we sat out there and people were stopping and taking our picture. Yes there is noise but we kept the doors open the whole time as its the sort of noise you want to soak up (boats chugging, italian conversation, bells tolling) Its was so hot I could not believe it, it was only in the nineties (high 30's) but there was just no breeze anywhere, I get the impression the place is always a bit like that (no breeze) because of the density of buildings You can walk to St Marks in five minutes, everywhere is a maze of beautiful little alleys, don't eat in the restaurant over the water from the hotel (first one you come too if you go across the bridge and turn left) they charge 12% on top for service (which is poor) and chips are for example 8 euro extra! so like 100 euro total for 2 for very average food (rip off) Anyway back to the hotel, breaskfast is good, don't forget to ask for the cappuccino, they also have bread rolls, ham, salami, cheese, hard boiled eggs, croissants & pan chocolate, cereal, yoghurt, orange juice & Prosecco!!! You can have as much as you like. The hotel will give you vouchers if you ask, free wifi (in the lobby) free water taxi to glass factory island (you must make your own way back) 10% off in hotel restaurant (like your gonna eat there) Don't forget to visit Lido if you have time, there is actually a beach there so take your trunks and towel if its hot!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: betsyto
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Venice and had wonderful time at Hotel Rialto. We were fortunate to have a room upgrade (at no extra charge) and were given a room overlooking the Rialto Bridge. Despite the hustle and bustle of the area, the room was very quiet and the air conditioning system was fantastic. The breakfast which was included was quite good, the service excellent and the desk staff very polite and professional. It is an easy hotel to find, and you can reach it from the train station without having to carry your luggage a long way. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: ZweiDrifters
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in July. The waterbus from the airport stops virtually outside so ideal for access. We arrived at 10.30 at night; check in was easy - staff had our details to hand & very helpful - porter took us up to our room. We paid extra for a room overlooking the canal and weren't disappointed. Room was large with traditional furniture. Good, clean bathroom with bath & shower. Mini bar - didn't use so can't comment on the prices. The windows are double glazed and there's air con in the room so noise wasn't a problem for us. Breakfast was good served from 7 til 10.30, continental, with extras if you wanted them. Staff waited on us as soon as we walked in to serve tea/coffee. We had a great stay here. Well worth the money & would definitely recommend. San Marco is 10 minutes walk away - just follow the signs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rialto, Venice, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: millmoll
Reviews.Content: Trip was booked through lastminute, and we used Trip advisor to read reviews on the Hotel Rialto, Venice. Hotel was in the perfect location, right next to the Rialto Bridge, lots going on. Hotel staff were professional and curteous, Porter took our bag to our room. I had requested a double room with a Canal View, we did get the double room, although VERY small, with a view to a brick wall, although we weren't that bothered, as was quiet and we didn't plan on being in the room that much. ( I heard since that the canal view rooms - and there are only about 10) are disturbed by the noise at night, lots of restaurants opposite and on pavement level under your window. We were in room 315. Warning: there were 80 very steep steps to get to our room, I'm 35 and fit, and it was a stretch! Hotel was clean, nice, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff delightful helpfull and curteous”
Reviews.Author: sovman
Reviews.Content: We arrived just after midnight on friday for our 35th wedding anniversary, our room was very small and I am very big so we asked to be given another room, this was not possible at the time of night but a promise was made to change in the morning. We were asked to pack and leave all to the staff, at lunch time our new room was ready and was superb, a suite in fact. No extra charge was made. Next day, our anniversary we exchanged cards and went out for the day, on returning we were presented with a bottle of champagne and glasses with a note congratulating us from all the staff, they had seen our cards. For all of the four day stay the staff were more than helpfull and having stayed in many hotels both socially and on business this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: SamPepys
Reviews.Content: The Rialto was everything we asked for. We booked a Canal view and the room was beautiful with plenty of size, fine bath. No complaints about noise here (I knew what to expect from the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge into the evening). The staff went out of their way to assist when a medical problem came up. Breakfast was fine. Obviously I didn't try the garden-view room so I don't know if there is a size issue with those rooms. If you can afford the canal view, I don't think you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: coloradotraveler31
Reviews.Content: The staff was very cordial, helpful and welcoming. The location of the hotel was right next to a vaparetto stop, which made it very easy to get around Venice. It was also a comfortable walk to St. Mark's Square. The rooms were very clean and larger than a lot we have stayed in throughout Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - very nice htotel.”
Reviews.Author: Niklasoslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at the Rialto end of April and we booked a room facing the Grand Canal. The hotel it self including room and staff where exactly what we hoped for. Professional - vert service minded, clean rooms and areas, great views - perfect localtion. Basically there's only one thing that pull down the impression, that is the noise from the busy Grand Canal and walkways below the windows. When situated right in the centre, by the canal, booking a room facing the canal - maybe you should expect noise. But we didn't expect the canal to be that busy for so long into the early moning hours. Take away this and the hotel is perfect. When booking a room - get one high up or not facing the canal, and you will be in the best possible localtion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but that's the only positive.”
Reviews.Author: ajcat
Reviews.Content: Had the WORLD'S SMALLEST HOTEL ROOM. Great thing about staying a whole week - you don't have to live out of suitcases. But the only storage we had was a couple of teeny-tiny drawers that barely held socks. So we lived out of our suitcases! The staff was not particularly helpful, and breakfast was just okay. If you can't afford to book larger rooms, don't stay here in a standard. The distances are short enough in Venice that location isn't the most important thing to consider. Just not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: TineadsTravels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay at the Hotel Rialto in Venice. We had Room 402 with a view of Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal. Huge room by Italian standards and furniture was Venetian which enriched the experience. This was my first (but not last) visit to Venice so staying beside the famous Rialto Bridge meant i) carrying bags from the Vaporetto to the hotel was not an issue and ii) you could always find your way to Hotel Rialto no matter where you wandered to. Breakfast was good - a cereal, cheese, meats and boiled eggs buffet affair which you can have al fresco. Staff were excellent, organised the opera and tickets to a palace tour in an efficient and courteous manner. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Venice was made all the more special at The Rialto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehendersons_9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently travelled to Venice to celebrate her birthday. It was our first stay in Venice and the hotel made the stay all the more special. The location could not be more perfect. If travelling from Marco Polo airport, take the Alilaguna ferry, as you arrive in Venice by sea and get dropped off 50m from the hotel. I booked a junior panoramic suite and the views over the Grand Canal were beautiful. We were slightly worried as other reviews complained about the noise but we did not encounter that problem at all. The staff were friendly and efficient and the room was beautifully furnished. We will definitely be returning to the Hotel Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Hotel Rialto”
Reviews.Author: Wewant2seetheworld
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Rialto on March 20, and 21, 2009, and loved it. I had stayed at the hotel on one previous trip to Venice about six years ago, and requested and recieved, the same room that I stayed at on the previous trip, (room 415). When you see pictures of the Rialto Bridge on postcards and such, they almost always show the Rialto Hotel, and room 415 is the top two windows on the left side of the building, so you can imagine the view. The price is pretty hefty for me but my wife had never been to Italy, so on our short whirlwind tour, I wanted to show her what I feel is the best of Venice, which most assuredly includes Hotel Rialto. The room was always clean and had that authentic Italian hotel feel to it. The breakfast was very good as well. The vaporetto stop for Rialto is right outside the front door of Hotel Rialto, so that makes for an easy transfer from the train station. All in all, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location....a must”
Reviews.Author: Longman24
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean, friendly hotel with a fantastic location. We had room 408 (Junior Suite) - our room had a wonderful view of the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal. What more can you ask for than stepping out onto the balcony and seeing such a wonderful view. Only 10 minutes after the porter taking our bags to our room when we recieved another knock on the door and greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne - nice champage also!! - what a nice touch. Some reviews state it can be quite noisy. I disagree, had no problem sleeping as Venice mainly shuts down at 11.00pm. The bustling of water taxi's ect.. during the day adds to the atmosphere of the wonderful city that is Venice. It was my first trip here and won't be the last. What I will say is it is expensive - 1 beer and a glass of wine 12e!! - not cheap but worth spending the money for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Icon...”
Reviews.Author: Amoras
Reviews.Content: Rialto Hotel is a beautiful hotel in the 2nd most tourist place of Venice, The Rialto Bridge, on Grand Canal. It is 10-15 min. walk to the S.Marko Sqr crossing the beautiful slips and romantic canals of the Town, and 10 meters from the 1st step of the Rialto Bridge. This is the 1st sight u see opening the window of your room. Notice that only some rooms have the wonderful view of Gr.Canal. There are some facilities in front of the hotel like Taxi boat station, Gondolas station and Vaporeto Station. These things make the place a little bit noisy, however there u can realize the differences of the localâ€™s life. Living & working by the waterâ€¦ Try to book a room in a floor as higher as it is possible assuring in that way more quite, wide view & privacy, as the firsts floor rooms are too close to the people passing outside the windows. Our room 404 (junior suite) was very large & romantic in its Venetian style. It was clean & the staff was kindly. Breakfast was nice (basic â€“ not too many choices) & you can have a hot Italian cappuccino in a few minutes. I could really stay again in that hotel visiting Venice at the futureâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good location, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Moonjoe
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly hotel with an amazing view and a great location. However, I thought the price was a bit high. We had family staying at other hotels that were cheaper, and I thought their rooms were nicer! In Venice, I don't think you can be in a bad location, so I am not sure this hotel was worth the price

Reviews.Title: “5th Trip to Hotel Rialto; Second this year”
Reviews.Author: glaucomadoc
Reviews.Content: The title should say it all. I was in Venice earlier this year (May 2008) and stayed, yet again, at the Hotel Rialto, during the Christmas Holidays 2008. The Christmas trip was with my wife and 3 young adult children. You can not beat the location, the views and the sounds. Yes, some folks will complain about the sounds, and yes, there are plenty of normal Venetian activity sounds to be heard, but in my opinion, that adds to the charm of the hotel. That is part of the experience. While I did not get the specific rooms I had asked for, the staff was more than helpful in helping us select equally desirable rooms. Spend the extra money for a Grand Canal view room; you will not be disappointed. Been there, done that, and will certainly do Hotel Rialto again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location RIALTO HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bananamanLeicester
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rialto was very good value for money. The staff were polite and helpful.The room was warm and cleaned daily.We were on the fourth floor with a view of shops and stalls.The location of the hotel right next to the Rialto bridge was the best place to be,easy for the local water buses,12 mins walk to St.Marks square and shops and bars and cafes everywhere. We were there in december,the restaurant is closed in winter but there are plenty of self service cafes at affordable prices.we found the local people helpful and there were signs in english if you didn,t speak Italian.We really enjoyed our stay in Venice and would certainly visit again.The three day pass used on local water buses and land buses on the lido was good value at 31euros with a single trip costing 6.50.We went everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ron047
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 days just before Christmas 2008. We stayed in room 402, the best view in Venice. We had a wonderfull vantage point to watch all of Venice's daily life. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and fun to talk with. We can't imagine staying anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: It just so happened that my check-in day to the Hotel Rialto occurred the day after Venice had its worst flooding in 26 years. I was seeing pictures of the Rialto Bridge area on CNN being flooded when I was in Roma. First of all, I have to say that in terms of location, this hotel rocks. Loved being in the center of town... Piazza San Marco is a 10 minute walk away, and even did walks as far as to the Ferrovia (Santa Lucia Train Station & Piazza Roma). 30 minutes, leisurely. As for the room itself, we booked a triple and got a room on floor 1 with no view. The furnishings were quite old, TV was small and outdated, but the bathroom was clean, modern and big. Careful if leaving the bathroom window open... our room ended up smelling like the sewer upon our return, even in December! Since the flooding impacted the lobby area, the computers for internet access were not set-up (4 euro per 30 min), so I was able to use the hotel's wi-fi which is not accessible from my room unless you had one near the lobby. The breakfast was a little bit below average. No orange juice but instead red grapefruit and some red grapefruit-orange juice mix? Breakfast consisted of traditional brioche, salami/ham, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, cereals, and yogurt. Coffee was strong. Found the whole experience below my expectations. You could get "extra breakfast" by paying a fee for bacon & eggs (5,50 euros), a ham omelette and some others. Staff was courteous and spoke English w/ no sense of annoyance. Have to say that Luca, a young tall Italian guy, that works through the evening and night shift, is very nice and cute. ;-) I would consider staying here again but would check other properties first. Liked the fact that the water boat docks were literally in front of the hotel which made lugging luggage a minimalistic effort while staying in Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy but perfect”
Reviews.Author: mungrat
Reviews.Content: Fab location - right on the Grand Canal - but be warned its a long way from the train station so if you're stingy and don't fancy forking out for a taxi then check your route through town first! It has a glossy entrance foyer, and the staff are charming. We stayed in one of the suites which are accessed by going through the hotel and into a back street, then up lots of stairs! Not recommended if you want/need a lift. The room was done out in Venetian kitsch which I loved - very shabby chic! The bed was hard though. The bathroom was huge and had a jacuzzi which was great in theory but when we used it we were terrified the rumbling and shaking would bring the ancient building down! And it leaked which was slightly alarming. The power supply was the usual put your key card in the wall to power things up. The air con worked but inevitably the room was sweltering when you came home after a day out. And the fridge wasn't on a separate connection and was therefore a tad pointless. There is a restaurant on the canal side which is part of the hotel. It was, as you would expect in Venice, pricey. I would recommend going further afield to find a decent, better value restaurant. Breakfast was pretty bog-standard, with too many people in not enough space. We sat at one of the two outside tables in an alley round the back which was more pleasant than sitting inside. The location is top notch, and if you've been to Venice before, its worth it to stay in an old smelly town house! But Venice is easy to get around on foot, so if you are mobile, try staying somewhere further out and you'll still have a fab time.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional, polite Venetian hotel - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Englishrose6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rialto for a extended weekend break five nights in all. The location is amazing right by the bridge and in the heart of bustling Venice on the Grand Canal. Although we arrived late at night we got a fast bus from the airport then switched to a water bus at the bus station which stopped right outside the hotel. We had room 111 at first and this was small with rather dubious brown stains on the walls. The next morning we asked to change and they gave us room 202 which was fabulous, very clean, Venetian in decor and very warm. Don't be afraid to ask for a different room as the hotel staff are charming and extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was typically continental with good coffee. Again the breakfast staff were excellent and very friendly. I have to say that I really had a great time here and after the first room could not fault the accommodation and service. The concierge booked us places at two operas and they were very efficient. We also left our bags in the room and they were fine. In fact the staff were so considerate when we asked to leave them. What is really good about this hotel is the prime location and is right next to the water buses. When you have over done the sightseeing it is so good to easily get back to the hotel to recharge the batteries. This was my first trip to Venice and I found it mesmorising in its beauty. It has knocked Florence off my top spot. The Venician people were very friendly and helpful. The worst thing about the trip was having to come home and not see the fading grandeur every day. How lucky are the Venetians to live among such beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: fuzzydog
Reviews.Content: 6 of us just spent 2 nights at this hotel which I would class as more a three star than four. Great location, but beware the noise of boats gurgling and chugging by from early morning thru late evening with the vaporetto stop right outside. I would take earplugs as revellers on the Rialto bridge right by the hotel kept us awake on both nights until well past midnight. The rooms were all a bit tired in that oh-so dated Venetian kitsch and in places a bit shabby. The breakfast is a small but ok buffet where any warm food apart from hard boiled eggs is extra. We found the staff personable enough and the location is very central and convenient and easily accessed. It was fine, but a three star hotel relying too much on its location, at four star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT....”
Reviews.Author: sightseer1Hampshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Rialto. As a single traveller I was given the tiniest room I have ever slept in, scruffy and tired and with absolutely no view - the bathroom was even worse, a minute shower, cracked tiles, grubby and generally in need of a really good refurbishment.. The staff were indifferent/rude, preferring to talk to one another rather than help out guests. This is a hotel that might have been good many years ago but now needs to be redecorated. A great disappointment, although the location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: AlewifeBoxHill
Reviews.Content: Not only was it value for money, but we had the most splendiferous view onto the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal from our room . The breakfast was excellent, and they also assisted us with arranging for a visit out to Murano, and other travel that we did. I left my passport behind at the Hotel, and they averted what could have been a major disaster by prompt courier delivery to an onward hotel. I cannot recommend this Hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel...Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Neuby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rialto in June of 07. Our room was nice enough and had a good amount of space. Our bathroom was huge. For some reason, it was about half the size of our entire room. I'm not sure if the design was the best use of space, but it was a nice surprise. The staff was very informative and friendly throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Ok...”
Reviews.Author: Fabbbi
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. But, staff, room (cleaning, bath, space) not very good. Breakfast is ok. Internet connection...they charge you (E4.00 per 30 min.) and sometime you don't know if you don't read the pemphlet beside the computer....Not very clear the pemphlet...

Reviews.Title: “You cannot beat the Location!”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe08
Reviews.Content: The Location makes this hotel! It is situated right next to the Rialto bridge and close to everything. The water bus stop is just meters from the hotel which makes it easy to get back to the mainland easily and at any time. The hotel itself is a bit dated with very old fashion decorations but it would be odd to have a modern hotel in this beautiful old city. The breakfast was good and there was seating outside along the Grand Canal which was even better.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: Wivenny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Grand Canal so is very convient to get to from the train by water bus. The hotel is old but well maintained. We paid extra for the canal view which was expensive but how many times to you see the Grand Canal as you go to bed and get up!! The breakfast is just ok. The usual of boiled eggs, ham and cheese. Enough to eat just not a great choice of fruit or breads etc. This is second time of staying here as we like the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, only for young people”
Reviews.Author: Chubasco_tr_ad_com
Reviews.Content: Really nice location and absolutely charming staff. But watch out if old people try to lodge: the lift only goes up to the first floor and we were staying at the third one, with really sloppy stairs. And we were lucky because the hotel has another back wing that you reach crossing an internal yard and you can get a room in a fifth floor without lift. So I donÂ´t suggest this hotel for old people and for couples with little babies. Breakfast is just correct, not luxurious, in a small room that can't take in all people comig at the same time. A bit uncomfortable. But tht's Venice. Decadent

Reviews.Title: “Everybody in Venice knows where Rialto is”
Reviews.Author: Triplovejoy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Good staff, good breakfast, very clean, good furniture. Location is super for walks. One of 3 bridges on Grand Canal, Grand Canal â€“ right here opposite the door, San Marco â€“ 5 minutes by step, La Fenice Opera â€“ 3 minutes. There was a window in toilet! TRIPLOVEJOY

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Diedre_8
Reviews.Content: Arrived by Vaperetto to the door of our hotel from the train station. It was so easy! The hotel was in the best location looking onto the Rialto bridge and down the Grand Canal it does'nt come any better than this. The room was amazing with a large chandelier in the middle and silk wallpaper. The furniture was of the Venezian style very elaborate. The whole place was fantastic if you are after the Venetian experience. Breakfast was good. The staff were very helpful and organised a daytrip to Marano to the glass factory for us. The veiw from our room was extraordinary but it did come at a price!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: docrick
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a two nights perfect location good for people who are travelling for the first time as the location is easy to find and as everyone know its very easy to get lost in venice view wasnt that great from our room though they has a beautiful terrace with views to the rialto bridge breakfast was ok

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a pity about the view!”
Reviews.Author: mightymac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for three nights in June 2007. We were travelling with friends who were celebrating their 25th wedding anniversary. The Hotel Rialto is in a great location - right by the canal, next to the river bus stop and only about a 15 minute walk to St Mark's Square, although the time to get to St Mark's does depend on how many shops you visit on the way! When we arrived to check in, we found our room to be perfectly adequate with a reasonable amount of space.
