The only downside was that the room was at the side of the hotel so the view from the window was of the next building only a few feet away. This made the room quite dark and the lights had to be on even during the day but a room with a view would have been more expensive so we probably got value for money. Just a word of advice, our friends were offered on check-in a really tiny room with virtually no space to even walk around the bed and a bathroom to match. However, having made a visit to our, much larger, room they soon went down to reception to ask to be moved to a better room. A better room was duly provided so it pays to ask for another room if you think that your room is exceptionally small, even by Venice standards. The continental breakfast was no more than adequate but at least it gave us something to start the day. Overall a pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jesslca321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Rialto for 2 nights and the location couldn't have been better. Its just feet away from the Rialto Bridge and right on the water. We had a great view of the Grand Canel. The rooms weren't the best, small and not 4 star but its Venice and everything is small.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly convenient”
Reviews.Author: Spruby
Reviews.Content: How's this for convenience -- the place is at the foot of the Rialto bridge on the Grand Canal. There's a water-bus stop mere steps from the front door. Best room, best shower of our entire Italian trip. Breakfast is included with the room. The buffet includes bagels and cream cheese, cereal, cheese, fruit, ham, hard-boiled eggs, milk, and yogurt. Women working the breakfast room will bring you cappucino, espresso, or tea. Across the Rialto bridge are several touristy restaurants (which are very convenient if you're a tourist). The Rialto is on several water-bus lines, including No. 1. The location works well for getting to the main attractions of Venice: La Fenice opera house, Murano glass factories and shops, and St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable weekend away”
Reviews.Author: mary030
Reviews.Content: stayed in rialto hotel 04/08 great location small hotel be very pleasant staff with good english . bed room to the back of hotel can be very noisey at night and pigeions loud in early morning shutters on window not close tight so wasnt sound proof . rooms clean and refreshed every day ,we stayed 3 days. breakfast fine continental type hot meal extra. hotel location 10 mins walk from st marc square , can really walk to all attractions. lots of steps over bridges not suitable for buggies or poor walkers .

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, rude staff, and terrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: DrJLC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Venice and Tuscany vacation and stayed at the Rialto Hotel for three nights. Despite the fact that the hotel has a great location, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. For starters, the lobby front desk staff was extremely rude which only confirmed other reviews that I had read before my trip. Secondly, after I paid an extra charge for a room with a grand canal view turned out to be a terribly small room with a grand canal view and no balcony. The room was on a second floor and just outside was the water taxi stop which meant that we had to hear the sound of large water buses (vaporetti) the whole night without any sleep. If this did not keep us up the herds of screaming drunk young adults waiting in line for the water taxi did. Everytime we approached the front desk with a concern, all we received was a bad face!!!! I also accidently made a mistake and forgot to request a baby bed for my one year old daughter and was given a hard time about it, despite the fact that the hotel was empty!!!Unbelievable!!!I will never ever return to this tourist trap anymore and hope you think twice before reserving here.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: mrsewing
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the hotel website for our anniversary. We made a mistake of buying a 3 day travelcard for the boats- you don't need one when you stay at hotel rialto, as it is walking distance to st marks square. Just buy a ticket to get you from bus station to the rialto stop - which is right outside the hotel! The hotel loction is directly outside the rialto bridge, and our room overlooked it. It was such a romantic view. In the morning opening the shutters, and looking out onto gondalas sweeping past. You can walk to st marks square and en route you will pass great cake shops, nice souveniers, and some smart clothing stores. We enjoyed climbing up to the roof of the cathedral on st marks square. We also enjoyed the gondala ride- who cares if it is expensive, you are in Venice!! Ideal for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: parisfanDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband and thought it was the perfect little hotel. Yes it is 3 star but it is decent for a 3 star. The location is superb. Impossible to get lost in Venice when you are staying here. breakfast is a basic continental breakfast and we had no complaints We did not have a canal view room but this was not a problem as we didn't spend very much time in the hotel but were out and about exploring this beautiful city. Would recommend a restaurant situated just across the Rialto bridge, turn left and it is the second restaurant in the row. Great food and very reasonable. Would also recommend the Rialto Markets for gifts etc during the day and great square of little bars at night. Much cheaper than drinking down around st marks All in all we adored Venice and will go back there again and again. And will stay in the Rialto Hotel again until my purse allow for the Gritti Palace!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leigh2709
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a short honeymoon in Venice in early November 2007. Initial impression of this hotel was great, as so many on this site have stated the location in great, as is a large portion of the hotel. We followed the bellboy up the stairs (lift only goes to first floor) and were alarmed at each new narrow staircase we had to climb - in total there were about 5. The room was located with 2 or 3 more in virtual attic space. The room was large, but rather grubby. The walls were lined with material (presumably for sound proofing?) which was pink and was scagged and stained all over. The bed(s) were clean but were two singles pushed together and bound by double sheets. The wooden shutters of the window opened on to delapadated rooftops, guttering and a drainage void between buildings which was overrun by pigeons causing a strong smell. We complained but the hotel was full, so we decided to just grin and bear it. We booked through Octopus, and it seems that they get allocated the worst rooms as this has happened before. Breakfast was pretty good, although very crowded at times, but the restaurant is extortionate, even compared to Venice prices, so we steered clear. Be very careful about room location with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fab location overlooking the Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: SarahAustin
Reviews.Content: Booked through Kirker who always get hotels right! Fantastic hotel with brilliant views of the bridge and the canal. Easily accessible to all tourist points. Food was ok but then we were only there for a light breakfast. There is a sun terrace which was lovely. Our room overlooked the canal. Was small but decorated in a very baroque fashion. Beautiful. WOuld definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: bazzaman1
Reviews.Content: myself and my girlfriend stayed here last week for 3 nights.the hotel is in a brilliant location for exploring venice...right at the foot of rialto bridge.the water ferry stop is just right outside the hotel.when arrive at the airport get the bus to piazza roma(edge of the city) and then get the water ferry no 82 which stops at rialto.the whole journey from the airport lasts approx 40 mins and costs 9 euro.the hotel reception is quite nice..although the exterior could do with a touch of paint! our room was quite spacious but did not have a good view..looking directly at another building! the room had sat tv and the bathroom was spacious and clean.the breakfast was just average...cold buffet breakfast.good coffee! the bar in the hotel is not actually accessible from the lobby.to access the bar one must go out on the street and then enter a different door.the bar prices are extremely high.the lobby staff were extremely friendly.i would recommend this hotel for its location and room rates.its quite basic but central and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: davfam
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five, 3 young kids (ages 4- 11). Just a small point to begin, star systems in different countries are clearly very different and should be used as an indication only. It is a waste of time to judge hotels by your countries star grading system. I did read all the reviews on this and other websites (including the hotels own site). Having done all this research I consciously booked in the annexe, so was not at all surprised by the alley at the rear of the hotel leading to the annexe. Yes there are stairs up but after eating all that pasta we really did not have a problem with this. Honestly how many times a day do you return to the room? The location is really fantastic and scenic, The ever popular Rialto bridge is at your doorstep. San Marco square is in easy walking distance and transport (waterbusses, gondolas etc) is also right there. Check in was courteous and efficient and our bags were carried up those stairs. The room itself was really gorgeous in Venetian style, fourposter bed etc. The room was in fact two bedrooms and a bathroom. It was fully airconditioned and had 2 single and 1 King bed as well as an extra bed for our youngest, these were all comfortable. The layout while being unusual in that the rooms are long and narrow cannot be helped as it is a restored original building. The bathroom was modern and fully equipped with soap and beauty products etc. The bath can also be use as a shower which was good for all ages! My only complaint was the awful view of not a hell of a lot, but one could pay more and stay in the "main" hotel. I would think however that the annexe would be quieter as it is away from the busy canal. Breakfast was the usual European affair, not everyones taste but sufficient. All in all I cannot find to much fault, in my opinion, at the price it cannot be beaten in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Venice - Horrible Location in the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorkaDay
Reviews.Content: Hotel location can't be beat! Water taxi and vaporetto stops right at the door! Staff very gracious and helpful. BUT our room was in a different building and across a public courtyard and alleyway from the main building and up more stairs than I could count. Access was only by executing a complicated series of "push this and swipe that" and those directions were given quickly! Didn't feel safe or comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Should've read ALL the reviews...”
Reviews.Author: rmdo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rialto after spending a few days in Naples and Rome. The location canâ€™t be beat. However, after riding the elevator up one floor, the bell boy tells us that we have to continue up the stairs. Five flights of stairs later, we arrive at our â€œroomâ€�. We open the 2 ft wide door and enter a dark, damp, smelly, 10 ft x 10 ft attic/ dungeon with no A/C and dirty walls. If you are familiar with the abundance of pigeons in Venice, you can imagine our dilemma. Should we open the window and risk allowing birds (and assorted bugs) into the room or sleep in super heated stale air? No they have no window screens. Throughout our stay, several other issues came up like the roaches in the bathroom, the smell of rotten eggs from the canals and the suspicious stains on the walls and carpet. Eventually, we made it though the three nights and were happy to go back home. On the plus side, internet access is free (in the lobby), there is a major vaporetto stop right in front of the hotel and they have a free tour to Murano. Donâ€™t expect help from the concierge unless you are interested in the tour company they work with. When my wife asked about a tour to the Veneto area, the answer she got from the man at the front desk was â€œthe Veneto region is very largeâ€�. What kind of answer is that!!!??? If we hadnâ€™t had such a great time in Naples and Rome, this place couldâ€™ve completely messed our vacation up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Topman1
Reviews.Content: November 2007 Just returned from 4 great nights in Venice to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary Hotel is very well located - close to all the attractions -easy walking distance - there is no need to use water bus apart from transfers to and from airport Although our room for the first night had a good view overlooking the canal and bridge we were offered a much better room front facing onto the grand canal which was ideal The staff were excellent nothing being too much trouble and I would recommend the hotel boths in terms of location and cleanliness etc HOWEVER if you are at the front of the hotel it can be noisy because of the early morning deliveries so we did use earplugs to ensure a good nights sleep On the plus side is the fact that the Rialto is one of the few hotels on the canal that actually has a 'pavement front' most of the hotels are on the waters edge! A great and truly memorable trip everyone should venice once in their life - It IS unique and even the weather was very kind to us! c

Reviews.Title: “Location wonderful, but check location of room”
Reviews.Author: Traveldoves
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel right at the Rialto Bridge, always crowds of people as you push open the hotel door. The hotel is very good, overall. Our only problem was the location of our room. The lift only goes to the first floor and from there it was 156 stairs up a narrow staircase to our room. Quite exhausting at the end of a long day sigthseeing. Luckily we had a jet bath in our room! Venice was a wonderful experience and we enjoyed our stay. The staff is friendly and the breakfast average. Do not know if we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: Shannonside
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in Venice on our 20th Wedding Anniversary, stayed in the Rialto Hotel. Perfect Location, you will not find better everything is on your doorstep literally. Bus,`taki, restaurants, shops,gondella, st marks sqaure leisurely 10 mins stroll Beautiful canal room on the 3rd floor, and very quiet considering the location. Staff extremely helpful anf friendly. Water bus stop outside your door perfect when arriving after dark. Hotel is more 3 star, but for such a short stay could not recommend strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FCOSEA
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the room in the back did not offer but a view of the wall in the alley. At a dear price. Room was dated and needed major renoavation. Granted I was stupid to leave my iPod in the bag (closed) and not put it in the safe, it was stolen: my bag opened and someone went through my personal stuff. Not pleasant. Make sure to lock in the safe all your valuable stuff or take it with you. Thieving staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: max107
Reviews.Content: August 27th Just returned from a 4 night break and couldn't fault anything. Had a room on the first floor overlooking the canal and the Rialto bridge. The room was large and kept very clean every day by the staff. The breakfeast was plenty and a good selection and sat on the terrace was wonderfull as you can watch the daily life of Venice unfold in front of you. The reception staff were very friendly and spoke excellant english. The location of this hotel was excellant for catching the water buses and taxis as the stops are right outside. All in all a very pleasent hotel with friendly staff and a great location wouldn't hesitate on returning in the future. To get from the airport you should take a water taxis a great experiance and the best way to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Do It!”
Reviews.Author: santacruzmonique
Reviews.Content: I am writing to you about my recent stay at Hotel Rialto located in Venice, Italy. First I want to compliment whom ever did their website. The pictures portray a large establishment, balconies overlooking the canal and great service. What we recieved was far from that. The one gentleman that did check us in was lovely and when I asked for a larger room he looked sincerely sorry, the rest of the staff was the complete opposite. Let me back up; our Junior Suite which we were paying $330/$350 a night for was not much bigger than my laundry room at home. The extra bed was only made with one sheet and a pillow that looked from a bad airline flight. The bathroom smelled of rotten eggs, the shower handle barely fit to be an upright shower and the toilet sounded as if it were about to errupt the entire night. After my son, actually vomitted TWICE, from the stench we were able to go out and almost enjoy the surroundings. We asked for a larger room but after being eaten alive, over 40 flea bites between us, we decided to finally, cut our loss and ask for a partial refund. We understood that the night we stayed and probably the day we were asking wouldnt be refunded; I was mortified when the very rude manager put his finger up as if to halt further conversation and told me in no....possible....way would any of my stay be refunded. Did I tell you about the sour eggs and clear coffee they tried to serve us as their 'gourmet buffet' We were able to find a lovely....extra large suite at Baglioni near San Marco Square, a beautiful view of the streets and an amazing breakfast included for only $50 more a day. They have a fabulous staff, amazingly clean rooms and should be rated above 5 star if possible. Hotel Rialto....should be closed, banned from advertising and exterminated. I hope this letter reaches your website as to warn any further possible victims that may fall prey to their ill advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rialto one night after arriving from a Greek islands cruise. The hotel is located right at the bottom of the Rialto bridge and therefore very convenient to visit Venice. The hotel reception staff were very helpful with all our inquiries and made us feel welcome. The room was large enough and had all the amenities we required. Since we were on the 2nd floor, however, we had a sleepless night, due to the noise from outside. Revellers were still around at 4 a.m. So, all was well with the hotel, but if you want to have a good night sleep, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ATL30306
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right at the Rialto Bridge. Our rooms were spacious and spotless. We had breath taking views of the Grand Canal right from our room. A delicious breakfast was included which we enjoyed on the private patio right on the Grand Canal. The concierge staff spoke perfect english and helped us book an amazing gondola tour and a tour to Murano. I'd stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: jjonathan
Reviews.Content: Be clear - when you book here you are paying for the location, so dont skimp on it, just pay the higher rate and get the Canal view. It is just awesome. As for the hotel and its services, we found that good too; helpful and courteous front desk (we had no trouble with the taxi they arranged for our departure); a good breakfast with plenty choice of fresh appetising stuff, excellent coffee(!) - take your breakfast outside on the cafe / daytime pizzaria and watch the Venice world go by - at 8am! I wouldnt hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our above average expectations”
Reviews.Author: Geewillikers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were extremely happy during our stay at the Rialto. We have each travelled extensively during our 50+ years and have stayed in many of the world's finest hotels. Additionally, I spent the first half of my working life in the Travel Industry and as a result I think I have a fairly critical eye; at the very least, I certainly expect value for money. We stayed in a Standard Double room with a Canal View for three nights in June and found it to be quite large by comparison. The decor was elegant and typically Venetian and even though there were a couple of small signs of wear, it was more or less as depicted on the website - besides which, when we were in our room, we spent most of our time gazing at the spectacular view from our two windows. As the weather was quite warm, we were happy to close the windows after dark and use the air conditioning, which was set at a perfect temperature - i.e. not too cold - and the double glazing on the windows was so effective we were unable to hear any noise that may have been emanating from the Ponte Rialto. I hasten to add that, we found the busyness of the area to be a positive experience, yet one that was very easy to escape the minute we stepped inside the hotel or, from just one street away in any direction. Without exception we found the staff to be courteous and helpful and if one accepts that the hotel is in Europe, rather than America, England (or Australia), one will find the breakfast not only typical but also, more than adequate. The phrase... "When in Rome do as the Romans do" springs to mind. Guests staying in rooms without a Canal view MAY not be as impressed as we were but we could not have wished for more. .

Reviews.Title: “Not Problems but Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: MrJCG1
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Venice. Having stayed at the very elegant Westin Excelsior the first time. I knew the Hotel Rialto couldn't possibly live up to those standards. However, this was my wife's first trip and I thought it would be best to stay in a more touristy area. The Hotel Rialto difinitely fits that bill. Within shouting (literally) distance of the Rialto bridge, the Rialto Hotel is right in the middle of Venice madness. Tourists flock to the bridge until very late in the evening (2:00 AM). Then delievary boats and the like all begin making their stops as early as 5:00 AM. The location is almost always buzzing with activity. With that being said, the hotel itself kept the noise out fairly well. I rented a junior suite which really wasn't much (I can't imagine what a regular room looks like). The room itself was clean and the bathroom was surprisingly nice and modern. The room was just large enough to accomodate the two of us, if travelling with a small child it could work, but anything more would be really cramped. Complimentary breakfast was typical but satisfactory. The one nicety was free internet access in the lobby. This was nice to send out a quick email to the family we "abandoned" back home. The staff was pleasant and happy to assist, however I did not find them to be all that knowledgable about the area. Two examples were not knowing where Novecenta (900). This is a fairly popular pizzeria/bar in the area (I have friends in Venice who know the place well). The second example is what really soured me on them. The night before leaving I asked the concierge to have a water taxi ready at 11:30 AM for our trip back to the airport. I asked him the cost and he said 90 Euros. This seemed right as it was the cost coming FROM the airport. We made sure we spent all of Euros the next morning (except the 90 we needed for the taxi). Upon arriving at the airport, we were surprised to learn it was 100 Euros. The reason was because it was consider a scheduled pickup. The hotel should have known this. Since we didn't have the Euros, we had to wash boats for an hour (just kidding). They were kind enough to take US currency. Anyway, in summary, the hotel was decent enough. I expected a bit more for the price, however you are paying for the location. The average person will find no problem with this hotel. Anyone, who might be a picky type, might want to look elsewhere. All in all, the hotel does it's job and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room 501?!”
Reviews.Author: monkeykieran
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, very very basic, but very very charming, and perfectly placed. You have to get a speedboat from the airport in, theres no other way to do it.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with the Rialto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJFields
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of June 2007 and the hotel and staff were fantastic. We booked a room (501) with a view over the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge which was simply stunning and once the windows were closed at night, we couldn't hear a peep from outside. Only one thing to avoid and that is the restaurant for lunch or dinner. It was always packed with customers, the view was second to none and the food looked great but the prices were unbelievably expensive. Definitely worthwhile exploring the back streets for more reasonable restaurants unless you have very deep pockets. A great spot for a picnic or just for Gondola watching was the foot of the Rialtio bridge on the opposite side to the hotel. It was hugely relaxing and entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: cab33141
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel located at the very base of the Rialto Bridge in Venice. Location is superb to access all the highlights of San Marco-Venice. We visited this past April 2007, and found the staff very helpful and friendly. They were very accomodating in providing us with entertainment suggestions and arranging reservations for us at several of the music venues. Our room was on the second floor and was an easy walk-up. The room itself was a bit threadbare, but was clean and comfortable with that old-world charm that you'd expect in Venice. Nothing fancy, but clean, functional, with lots of character, and surprisingly quiet and comfortable. The breakfast provided in the morning was always the same and unvarying, with a selection of dry cereals, hardboiled eggs, ham and cheese slices, juices, and fruit. Strong European coffee worked just fine for me! All in all, we found the breakfast-along with the room-entirely satisfactory if not spectacular. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and we intend to stay here again on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved staying ta the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: Zjahn
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Rialto was awesome. The service was excellent, the food was excellent. The rooms were gorgeous. It is very central to all amenities. There were some days that you just did not want to get out of bed so you can just get the feel of being part of history. We did a lot of walking in Venice as we tried to see as much as possible and was glad to come back to a clean hotel, friendly staff and a gorgeous room. I have told my partner that when we go back to Venice, we will definitely book in at the Rialto again. Thanx to Rialto staff for making our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot”
Reviews.Author: MaddieIsabelsmum
Reviews.Content: Great location - we had a room over looking the bridge - nosiy but it just seemed to add to the atmosphere. One you close the windows and the oringinal shutters it was very quite. The water bus drops you off out side so really easy to get to! Breakfast was so so. The roof terrace is great to have a drink on after a long day walking and the view is great. Overall we had a very pleasent stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: julianuk
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay here mid week and weren't disappointed. Location in the centre of town is ideal to fan out from and there is a Water bus stop right outside. Double room was fine but only a shower (no bath). The breakfast included was a selection of meats and cheese, rolls, eggs and fruit. Staff were helpful. Would happily stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Centrehouse
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Good Breakfast. Canal view room very noisy as boats load and offload. Single room matchbox in size!, but clean. The location beside the bridge and the water taxi stop makes up for most things. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: AlPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our group of 4 adults and 4 children. The hotel ensured that our rooms were altogether - which was really great. The rooms were clean and pleasant but with poor views but the hotel's location (right near the Rialto bridge) more than made up for this - and there is a stunning view of the Grand Canal from the hotel terrace on the 1st floor which you should not miss. The staff were very pleasant and the front desk staff were very helpful. On the last day there we had to check out at 12 noon, but we didn't leave Venice till 8pm, the hotel staff looked after our bags and offerred us free use of a bathroom for showers before we caught our train. I would stay here again, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Vickilancashire
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Rialto having read the reviews on here. I cannot fault the staff, the beds were changed every day and the room tidied, they were pleasant and spoke when you passed them. The room was good for the money we paid and the breakfast was typical continental breakfast with lots of it altho not a great choice. It is central for all the sights so contrary to the other reviews I thought it was good value and very clean. My one thought is as it is January the bar could have been open and there was no restaurant but they do advise of this on their website. All in all a very pleasant stay so give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: karenrubi
Reviews.Content: I had a single room overlooking the Grand Canal. It was tiny and very servicable. It was perfect for what I wanted it for. I was there for 3 nights and would definately go back. The staff was very nice and the rooftop terrace was a great place to sip wine and watch Venice. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: fabiolina
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rialto approximately 7-8 times over the past 18 years. I have also stayed at other hotels, but keep returning to the Rialto because of the location and staff. If what you are looking for is luxe, do not stay here. It is not a luxury hotel, nor do they pretend it is. I have never paid an exhorbitant (for Venice) price for my rooms and have always been treated extremely well. I have never seen the staff be anything but polite and accomodating. If you have ever been in Venice, especially at night, the location is not to be beat as you can always find it, no matter how much you wander. I will always return to the Rialto when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot: worth the few snags”
Reviews.Author: changingtack
Reviews.Content: LOCATION? Excellent spot: ideal for the water-buses, and for finding our way back through the maze of alleys, as Rialto is one of the few sign-posted destinations (the others are San Marco, Ferrovia & P.Roma). And it was nice to send postcards featuring our hotel. STAIRS? Yes, we had to climb 26 steps from the top of the lift, and 72 steps on the day it broke down. ROOM? Fine for sleeping, dressing & washing, but not for sitting around in. DIRTY? No, our room and shower-room were clean STAFF? OK, business-like.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gregw01
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the diversity of opinions regarding this hotel. I spent a weekend at the Rialto during November 2006, and it was superb in all respects! We were fortunate to be upgraded to a Junior Suite overlooking the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge - an awesome view! The room was spacious and immaculately clean. The floor we were staying on had obviously been renovated recently. The bathroom had a separate bathtub and shower cubicle, and was supplied with good quality toiletries. The breakfast was adequate: breadrolls and pastries, preserves, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, cheeses, ham, boiled eggs. Cappuccino, espresso, caffe latte were available on request at no additional charge. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. All in all, a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Stairs”
Reviews.Author: Tuscan01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in October 2006. Prior to booking I wish I had know about all the stairs. The lift only goes to the first floor which is not much help when you are on the top floor. The room was just fair and the bathroom floor was constantly filling up with water from who knows where. The staff were unfriendly and not all that helpful compared to other places I visited in Italy. Great location next to the Rialto Bridge but would definitely not stay there again. The stairs would be the major reason for not returning. To get to my room it was at least 6 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dirty Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Ijustgotback
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Very dirty, I do not want anyone to waste any money on this. We stayed here for one out of three nights because it was extremely dirty. Management actually told us that we as AMERICANS are trying to get out of our contract for a cheaper hotel because AMERICANS are cheap. Nasty, Nasty, Nasty. I give this a do not even think about it. Will add photos later. I just wanted to get this out before anyone even thought about it.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: coachie
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days post Cruise. The staff were great. Nothing was a problem for them. I got the room I asked for (near lift) but it was not as clean as you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Air-con was on warm/hot /off (it is winter now sir) and we got bitten to death by what I hoped were mosquitos. The hotel sprayed the room for me which sorted out the problem but the room needed a spring clean (probably due to the air-con). Venice is expensive but it is great. Hotel is central for everything and there is a constant buzz in the air (no, not the mosquitos). Enjoyed the experience but perhaps we could of done better.

Reviews.Title: “A view at a price”
Reviews.Author: Julie-David
Reviews.Content: Excellent position next to the bridge, but be aware that there are people there all day and night. As this was to be a very special holiday for us we paid for a junior suite (expensive) but were dissapointed with the view - overlooking the vapporetta stop and over a busy food shop. We asked for a different room and were told none available but eventually others appeared and after 3 further rejections we were given the most fantastic room I've ever stayed in (although more expensive). The room was very large and beautifully decorated and had a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Air conditioning allowed us to close the windows/doors at night to cut out noise from the bridge and so sleep well. Breakfast was very basic and not too enjoyable - squash not juice etc, but good coffee. We didn't eat evening meals in the hotel but went out and tried the many many fabulous restaurants in the city. St Marks square at night is amazing! Traveller tip - bring lots of money!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view at the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: atrebor
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a view of the Grand Canal as it was our anniversary.The room was lovely with a wonderful view of the Canal. We were surprised at a previous comment about the staff as we found them very friendly and efficient. The hotel is in a brilliant position for exploring all the regions of Venice and with so many restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GuestVisitor
Reviews.Content: The hotel website creates an image that is far grander than the reality. The entrance is OK but the rest of the building is a little shabby. Our bedroom was up about 6 flights of stairs, along lots of corridors and I couldn't say what building it was actually in by the time I got to it. The stairs would have been difficult/impossible for an elderly person. The room was small but OK. The bath had a large beam over it which made showering difficult for anyone over about 5 feet tall. It also had a jacuuzzi but this produced a leak at 2 places as soon as it was switched on and consequently the floor would have been flooded if we had carried on with it. The window looked on to roof tiles almost within touching distance which were home to lots of pidgeons which were noisy at night. There was no view. Breakfast was just acceptable but could have been better. The staff were polite but i didn't ask for much more than my key when I returned. The location couldn't be much closer to the Rialto bridge without being on it. This was a mixed blessing as the bridge is packed from morning to night. I wouldn't stay so close next time and perhaps tellingly would choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Roboman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay. This hotel is right next to the Rialto Bridge and has a fantastic little terrace overlooking the Grande Canal. What can be better than sitting drinking a bottle of local vino and watching the gondolas float past? The hotel itself is clean and tidy, the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a typical continental (with great coffee) although it can be supplemented with other things at a cost. The room we had was small but adequate and had everything we needed. It was ornately decorated in Venetian style. Remember that this hotel is an old Venetian building and it would lose its character if modernised. The biggest advantage of the hotel is its location. Right on the Grande Canal with a Vaporetti stop, taxis and gondolas right outside. No lugging suitcases through narrow streets and over bridges which most people have to. Yes its a bit pricey but then Venice is not a cheap city. I have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Rialto

Reviews.Title: “Saved by location”
Reviews.Author: MyRating
Reviews.Content: If location is the key then this hotel can't be beaten by many - its situated right next to the famous Railto bridge, and our junior suite overlooked it. Despite that, the suite smelt of damp (we are in venice), the decor is antique-shabby and the layout of the building is a maze. They do have a lift but you'll still end up going up and down the stairs for certain rooms. It was great to gaze out the windows at the river and bridge at night with a bottle of champagne and its brilliantly located - but that is pretty much all you pay for and it wasn't cheap! Obvious note: light sleepers bring earplus, the waterbuses are noisy and Railto is a very popular stop day or night.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, uncomfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: jimtpsf
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many places, but have never visited Italy. I planed a two week vacation visiting Rome, Positano, Florence, Pisa and Venice. Everywhere I went, especially the hotel staff, was very helpful with directions, suggestions, etc..., except THE HOTEL RIALTO. Any question I asked (directions, restaurants, sites to see, regular general questions that are normal to ask), it seemed I was making the employees go out of their way. Let me give you a couple other reasons/experiences, to help prove my point: 1)Checking in: When asked for a map of the area (all big cities in Italy provide maps to tourists for free at the hotels), I was told to come back later, they were too busy...(Unfortunately for the employees, I understand Italian, they assummed I didn't) The real reason was the two desk employees were trying to figure out who's break it was, and NO, there was nobody else at the counter but me and my wife...NICE 2) The Room: My wife and I were on our honeymoon, so I decided to get a room overlooking the Grand Canal. These rooms were 360 euros (almost $500) a night, which I didn't mind spending due to the occassion. The view was nice, but the room was slightly larger than a shoe box. The only good thing about the bathroom was I quickly found where the ant hole was so I could block it...When told about the ant problem I was told to put a wet piece of toeilet paper on the hole, it should keep them out as long as the paper is kept wet...NICE Even without the ant issue, this room was very overpriced, you are overpaying for LOCATION only...There are plenty of nicer hotels in the area with a Grand Canal view that are cheaper with nicer, cleaner, and larger rooms.. 3)Check Out: This was the most impressive part of the HOTEL RIALTO: Per their website, honeymooners receive compimentary bottle of champagne, as well as some other items. When I booked the hotel, via their website, I also inquired about flowers being in the room also, which they told me would be 50 euros(which I agreed). The flowers and champagne were in the room upon check-in(surprisingly, considering the lack of professionalism throughout the hotel). While checking out the concierge first demanded the flowers be paid by cash only, which seemed odd. When I informed him to put it on my credit card because I didn't have cash, he became irate, but eventually did it. Later when I checked my billing on my credit card, I noticed the concierge charged me 100 euros for the flowers. When I contacted the management regarding this error, they told me, too bad, and anyway, the bottle of champagne was 70 euros so you got away with 20 euros, you actually owe us. NICE To make things clear, as a travelor, I never ask too many questions, I try not to bother people too much to a fault, but thats just me. Not that it would justify any of the above, but there was no INCIDENT, or anything, where I angered anyone, all this was unprovoked. I still have the WHATEVER attitude regarding this, because I didn't want it to ruin the memory of a great honeymoon. I don't believe this was because I was American, I believe it was because, they thought, I was ONLY an English speaker. I seen similar treatment to a couple from Austrailia as well. Don't get confused by the name of the hotel, it definitly is not the only, and surely not even close to the best, hotel near the Rialto Bridge. My suggestion is to stay at a hotel, overlooking the Grand Canal perhaps, but slightly away from the bridge (because it is noisy until 4am...But definitly, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL, YOU CAN DO MUCH BETTER!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: tempas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location unless you want to stay across town in St. Marco square. The staff are very friendly. The rooms are clean and modest size but very pink and feminine. The staff had great suggestions for places to visit and restaurants to eat in. Right next door is a wonderful gelateria. We went to the islands of Murano and Burano (my favorite). A must if you have the time. Breakfast was typical European continental, dining room is small so arrive early. Wi-fi was down so confirm before you leave if it is important to you. There is one computer in the lobby for internet access

Reviews.Title: “Still reasonable upon a second visit”
Reviews.Author: BelJCG
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here 7 years ago, and when we decided to return to Venice (a town I love) we stayed here again. Not because the hotel was so outstanding that we were desperate to go back but because we felt it was - and is - a 'low risk' option. Its very convenient - 10 minutes on the fast water bus from the station and then you're there, no need to trek far with luggage. The reception staff were very Italian (ie not overly fawning) but very helpful and welcoming. Our room was in the annex, and I was a little taken aback when we followed the porter down various dark alleways to an unmarked door! The room itself, however, although furnished in an older ' traditional' style - chandeliers, older style wallpaper and bed dressing, was large, cool through the air conditioning and quiet. The bath even contained 'jacuzzi features', although upon pressing the button it made such a noise and erupted so that I felt myself & bath were about to disappear through the door. Breakfast was fine. I'm sure this isn't the best hotel in Venice, but being slightly away from the maddening crowds of St Marks Square and not having to travel down the lovely narrow streets of Venice before checking in, makes it an easy one to use as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: chelfie
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, with a vaguely Victoria's Secret/Tiffany & Co. decor (aka the room was PINK PINK PINK with padded walls and light blue furniture...) A slight problem was that the mattresses kept falling off the bed frame and so my friend finally had to sleep on the floor. We had a great view of the Grand Canal and were very near some excellent gelaterias.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice and Location but Hotel is not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated right in the middle of Venice. The staff is friendly and helpful BUT the room was small, dark and depressing. The bath tub was so narrow you really could not sit in it - I am petite and even I had difficulty. To add to the discomfort it was a European shower so you really couldn't stand! I can't imagine how a 6-foot American would manage in such a circumstance. Venice is marvellous, but for the price we paid - over $300 a night, I do not think we got good value for our money. ---- has a 5.0 rating - it's more like a 3.0.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: anaismum
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Rialto for 3 nights the end of may - the location is fantastic enabling us to nip in/out with our purchases so we could carry on sight seeing with no bulky items. The staff were extremely nice and quite helpful in regards to excursions and any other queries we had. Breakfast was included and there was great variety although you have to pay extra if you want bacon, omlettes or other extras. The only downside was we had to climb six flights of stairs to get to our room which was tiring after a long day sightseeing as the lift goes to only two floors ( 100 - 330 ) & (400 +) and our room seemed to be up in the attic section of the building - we had also requested a smoking room which we did not get and the view was terrible ! - just loads of roofs and gutters! However, the decor is quite charming in a typical venetian style which made it nice for a romantic getaway. i would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel But they are in league with ripoff artists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd probably give this hotel a 3-4 rating except for one main problem, their business practices. In every room in the hotel are 3 cards advertising a phone service for calling the US. Foolish me assumed that while it would be expensive (no rates listed of course) it wouldn't be an obscene ripoff. This company ended upo charging me US$40 for a 3 minute phone call. Research on the company shows that the hotel gets a %25 kickback of the charges, so it's to their great advantage to ripoff their own customers. There are many great hotels in Venice, do yourself a favor and stay in one managed by someone with ethics.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: Trickster
Reviews.Content: We visited the Rialto last weekend (26-28th May). It was our first visit to Venice and was a special birthday surprise for my fiancÃ©e. I chose the Rialto after spending alot of time researching various hotels in Venice because of its location / ease of transfer and its epitome of a true Venetian residence. I was not disappointed. There is a desk at the airport (Marco polo) after you come through the security gate where you can book a direct transfer by car to the dock and then water taxi which lands right outside the front door. The cost was 100 euros but we were in the hotel room within 30 mins of stepping off the plane. The water taxi also gives you a great first view of Venice and you have that 'film star' feel as youâ€™re escorted off and into the hotel. I booked with the hotel direct through their website and paid 380 euros per night for a beautiful suite overlooking the Rialto Bridge. If it is a special occasion, this is the perfect start with a four poster bed and the stunning views. Prior to arriving, I was also able to make some additional requests such as flowers, champagne in the room and restaurant reservations for Friday and Saturday night. It is very important to try and work out where youâ€™re going to eat in Venice and to book if possible. There are a number of high priced, low value establishments that charge alot for very little just because of their location. I can highly recommend Alle Testiere on Calle del Mondo Novo (half way between St Marks Square and the Rialto). A small intimate restaurant serving excellent fish with a charismatic owner who is only too happy to help you choose the perfect meal. You must book in advance as there are only 22 covers in total. Venice proved to be the romantic get-away we hoped for, the obligatory gondola ride (80 euros), sipping cocktails in St Marks Square and getting the lift up the bell tower were duly accomplished. The Rialto markets on Saturday morning are well worth seeing as is trying to get lost in the meandering streets, especially on the other side of Venice from the bridge where the madding crowds are significantly smaller and less claustrophobic. I'd certainly consider the Rialto again for a special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Choice You Will Ever Make”
Reviews.Author: FortWorthTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rialto is everything represented in the advertisement. From the moment we arrived we were impressed with the location, the staff, the room, and everything about this hotel. Literally at the foot of the Rialto Bridge, you are in the center of Venice and all the city surrounds you. The staff at the reception is composed of the most professional group of people you will find in any hotel. The rooms are large, beautifully decorated, and very quiet (the shower in our room is absolutely the largest we have ever had in all European travels). The breakfast buffet was complete and the staff was very prompt in fullfilling every request. The ride from the train station to the hotel is only 10 min by waterbus. A traveler choosing this hotel will be rewarded with a comfortable stay and when you leave you will never forget the magnificance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl126
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rialto in May 2006. The location of this hotel cannot be beat for convenience to everything in Venice. We loved looking out our window and seeing the Rialto Bridge right next to us. People watching is great and there is a little cafe with tables right up against the bridge that is perfect to watch people walking by, the gondolas and water taxis on the Grand Canal, and bask in the sun while sipping a refreshing bellini. Unfortunately, they had the AC turned off so unless you kept your window open, and there was alot of noise below, it got kind of warm in the room. the room was adequate, nothing special, and the bathroom was quite good. We had a litte trouble getting on the water taxi but once we figured it out, you can get off right near the Rialto. This is a good thing if you are dragging alot of luggage with you. If you take the water taxi from the airport, when you get off at San Marco, go to the left over one canal and you will pick up either taxi 82 or 1 and get off right at th Rialto. If we ever go back to Venice, I would definitely consider the Rialto again just for the convenient location. We had a Grand Canal room and it was easily accessible from the elevator. Not sure if you got one of the other rooms how convenient to an elevator it would be. Alot of steps to rooms at this hotel. Be sure to ask questions or you may be dragging your luggage up alot of steps. That is definitely not a GOOD thing.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous kitsch hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sammi-loves-shopping
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like something out of a disney film with lots of gold and rococco styling. The hotel staff were a gem (despite the fact we rolled up on our first day at 0100 due to travel problems). I lost my passport and luggage on the way to venice and the staff could not have been more helpful and understanding. The location is fabulous and the room service breakfast was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Tip top”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is perfecly located for a trip to Venice. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are lovely. People mention that its noisy as its right on the canal but its not at all, the only problem was a musky smell in the corridors.. I would stay there again (and its right by the boat stop!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: KRZ-Malta
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-day stay in Venice. Chose Rialto for location and do not regret one bit. Staff very friendly, giving proper recommendations where to go visit, eat and walk around. Rooms very quiet, comfortable enough (not massive but adequate), b'fast was good enough. A little bit nosy at night but once you close windows, all is fine and you still get a well-deserved sleep. Locatin was super: a water bus-stop just outisde hotel, 10 minutes away from Piazza San Marco. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived via a walk through the narrow streets via san marco to find a very busy Rialto bridge. The hotel itself is right next to the bridge in a great spot. Our room ,which we had insisted on was a room at the front with a canal view, absoloutly superb if you are a deep sleeper because the canal never closes with all sorts of deliveries etc through the early hours and the italians do like to shout.would reccomend hotel and the area as had a wonderful time. Will visit again but maybe a bedroom at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price...”
Reviews.Author: mcd724
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here during the first weekend of Carnival. It was an excellent choice and well worth the price we paid for a junior suite with a canal view. The water bus stops just in front of the hotel and makes all of Venice accessible all day and night long. The suite was large enough for four women and their luggage, so no complaints regarding the size of the room. However, the bathroom was on the small side. The decor is typical Venetian and you really feel like you are getting a real taste of Italy. We weren't bothered by the foot or boat traffic along the Grand Canal. Breakfast was included but we never made it down in time. Having the Rialto markets right outside was very convenient for picking up last minute souvenirs. I would not recommend the hotel restaurant. The service was poor and the food wasn't very good. However, right next door there is a little place with great panini sandwiches. The location made it the perfect place for experiencing Carnival.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: JanetteUk
Reviews.Content: This was as central as you can get, right by the Rialto bridge and with the vaporetto stop outside. Some might think it a little noisy, if in a Grand canal facing room, due to all the restaurants below and along the canal but we thought it all a part of the bustle & experience of being in the heart of Venice. Prices were reasonable compared to the Riva Schiavoni & St Marks Sq area. The famous Rialto markets are right opposite, just across the bridge and St Mark's Sq a 10 minute stroll through the lovely winding Venetian streets & alleys. The staff at the Rialto were multi-lingual & very friendly & helpful on the whole. Continental breakfast was buffet style with a very wide choice & hot breakfast items available for a small suppplement. We'd definitely want to stay here again when we do back to Venice. Take earplugs if you're worried about noise and want to have the Grand Canal view. We had a junior suite which was very spacious and comfortable and immaculately clean. Do let them know if it's a special occasion, in our room there was a bottle of Prosecco and 2 glasses in a cooler on our arrival as it was our anniversary. A huge benefit of the Rialto Hotel is how easy it is to find - right by the 1 & 82 vaporetto stops so you don't have to spend any time hunting through the back streets with your luggage in tow - remember you can't take a car to your hotel so this was an important point. All traffic stops at the Piazzale Roma and you're on a boat from there so we were relieved to be in a hotel whose location made the journey so easy. We booked through Citalia but you can book direct with the hotel by using their website (-)rialtohotel(-)

Reviews.Title: “Just superb !”
Reviews.Author: welshglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Some basics about the geography. Venice City is an island (or rather a series of islands) set out about a mile or so from the Mainland in a sea water lagoon. It is connected to the Italian mainland by a causeway which carries a railway line and a roadway. Both the railway terminus and the end of road transportation is at the end of the causeway at Piazzale Roma (Rome Square). Venice's airport - Marco Polo Airport - is on the mainland about 10 miles away from Venice City, (although some budget airlines - like Ryanair fly to Treviso Airport, about twice that distance away). If you fly into Marco Polo the choice of transport to Venice City is either by private water taxi (90 Euros per boat one way); or a combination of bus or taxi to Rome Square/ Piazzale Roma (the closest place that road vehicles get to Venice City) and then transferring to a Vapporetti water bus (5 Euros per person) from there along the Grande Canal to the Rialto Vaportti stop - right outside the hotel. We pre-booked a taxi transfer with ATS (airport transfer services) which was 30 Euros to Rome Square and got the Vaporetti afterwards. Total transfer time about 1 hour. There's also an hourly express water bus from the Airport to St Marks Square (15 Euros each) - but you'll still need to get the Vaporetti from St Marks Square to the hotel at an extra 5 Euros each. The top tip really is to get the more expensive but "door-to-door" private water taxi from the airport and save all the fuss. Now the Rialto Hotel -what a great hotel! We stayed at the Rialto late last month, during Carnevale week in Venice. This was our first visit to the city and the carnival atmosphere certainly added to the experience. Carnevale is the week or so leading up to lent each year. The hotel is a charming 3 storey pink building, about 150 years old, set among similar buildings, right on the Grande Canal, about 10 metres from the Rialto Bridge. The reception is only a few steps away from the Vaporetti (water bus) stop at Rialto and is nicely appointed. Reception staff wear gold-trimmed, crimson velvet tunics, white ruff collars and are multi-lingual. Dining-room staff and the bell staff are similarly attired in 'period' uniforms. Our room (131) was along a maze of pristine pink marbled corridors. The door to our room had gilded panels - an ornate theme echoed on the cream-painted Italian wooden bedroom furniture within. Beautiful pink pavilion-striped padded fabric wall coverings, matching water-marked silk bed-covers and canopy. Lovely Venetian glass mirror and chandelier. Shutters on the double-glazed windows. Immaculate house-keeping and efficient individual climate controls in each room. Breakfast was included in the tarrif we booked on-line (through GTA hotels) and comprised the usual hot and cold continental buffet, with fruit, croissants, ham, salami, cheeses, cereals, yoghurts, juices, coffee, eggs etc. The hotel is in the centre of everything with some beautiful restaurants nearby - ranging from expensive fish restaurants (like the Cafe Grande Canal across the bridge - two course dinner, with lobster was 200 Euros for 2 persons)to great little Trattorias (like the Aquilla Nera) up an alleyway from the Campo San Bortolomio Square behind the hotel where dinner was around 40 Euros. St Marks Square is clearly signposted and a 10 minute walk through the cobbled streets. The Campenile Bell Tower, Basilica Church and Doge's Palace are all there along with pigeons galore - to feed for 1 Euro a bag. Admissions to the Campanile, Doge's Palace and Basillica are extremely reasonable - between 6 to 15 Euros for adults. The hotel has great souvenir shops and stalls all around, selling local cheeses, silk ties, glass, carnival masks to sports shops and more keychains and fridge magnets than most other tourist traps. Gondolas go from outside the hotel - but haggle with the Gondolier - a 40 minute trip should be no more than 100 Euros - expensive - but a MUST DO in Venice for the first time. This is an excellent, 4 star hotel, with furnishings which exude the ambience of Venice. Well situated, clean and stylish - the ideal choice for the tourist visiting the sites of this wonderful city. We travelled with our 10 year old son who loved the city. All the restaurants - even the fanciest - will happily rustle up things not on the menu such as a margherita pizza or french fries for fussy little eaters and feeding the birds in St Marks Square always pleases kids. A great city for romantics, photographers, shopaholics, families and those who love art, architecture and history. Something for everyone !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, top position”
Reviews.Author: bulldogsfight
Reviews.Content: excellent postion , surprisingly good for 3 star hotel,staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Rialto Hotel was not only in an excellent position it was of great standard for a 3 star hotel. We actually checked into Al Graspo De Ua for the first two nights in Venice (booked by our travel agent) and found it was terrible (see our review!) When we decided to extend our Venice stay for another two nights we went to see the Rialto and found that it was cheaper and in a better position and the staff were very helpful and it had a lift! Breakfast was the usual - we found it better to drink coffee out in Italy, but it was adequete for what we needed. St Marco Square, Rialto Bridge, the railway station and heaps of shops were in walking distance and we were able to spend our days wandering around the local area and returning to our hotel room when we needed to put away the shopping or put our feet up! We were offered a free tour to Murano Island during as part of our stay at the Rialto which meant that a canal taxi took us out to the Island and we were shown the glass blowing factory and shown the beautiful original glass pieces (one of a kind and more expensive then what you find in the souvenir shops in Venice). The stuff was beautiful and you get a 50% discount off the marked price, we were unable to purchase any because we would have had to get it back to Australia, however would have loved to! Be warned though that the tour ends in the souvenir shop of the factory and you have to find your own way back to the hotel (we weren't told this). And whilst its only a cheap ferry ride back to Venice we wondered whether we would have been treated differently if we had purchased items from the exhibition?

Reviews.Title: “Terriffic Location”
Reviews.Author: jfzola
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Rialto for a long week-end break in mid Nov 05. Booked a room overlooking the Grand Canal/ Rialto Bridge. Wonderful location and base for sightseeing, eating out and people watching! Hotel accomodaion seemed to exceed the three star official rating with everything being "just so". Room size was more than adequate and exceptionally clean. Windows double glazed with excellent effect of keeping the very early canal workers outside and allowing us to sleep in peace. Wardrobe/hanging/drawer space were ample and, again, spotless! Staff very polite and accomodating and check out quick and easy. Breakfast room was small but run very efficiently. Nothing special about the breakfast but quality was good, as was quantity. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in this wonderful City. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the night after our cruise returned to Venice. Great location. Get off the Valporetto (sp) and roll your luggage right into the lobby. Great staff, very helpful and accommadating. Has a good size elevator (lift for you UK folks). Room was very nice. Large bathroom with large shower, great water pressure. Room spacious for Europe, clean and quiet. The night before the cruise stayed at a hotel in the San Marco area that was more money and much less of a value. Breakfast was above average and the breaklfast room is nice. Check out was quick and with no surprises. Way above average 3 star!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: aestheticdesign
Reviews.Content: Is this the best hotel in Venice? I believe so; the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable in our new surroundings, the room was truly breath-taking from the glass chandalier to the fourposter bed and the morning breakfast was above standard. To add to this every morning me and my family were awoken by the view of the Rialto Bridge which as you can imagine was a once in a life time experience but the best thing for me, in terms of simple pleasures, that the hotel had to offer was the panoramic terrace; available to all visitors although few ever take the time to see, it has views all the way up and down the grand canal and admittedly my favourite part of my trip to venice was buying a italian wrap from the shop downstairs, taking it to the terrace and sitting in the sunshine all afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great staff make this the hotel to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJared
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best location to stay in Venice. It is so easy to get to when you arrive because it is just steps away from the Rialto Bridge boat ramp and with bags in tow you walk straight into the lobby. It is also easy when walking around Venice because there are many signs pointing in the direction of the Rialto Bridge so you can find your way back. It is in the heart of Venice and everything is within walking distance. There are ample resturants and shops next to the hotel. The rooms are nice and large for a european hotel and the staff could not have been nicer. I would recommend this to anyone staying for the first time in Venice because of the location and it's helpful staff. For me the hotel is what makes a trip and in this case I had a wonderful time and couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Iam often travelling to Venice and stayed in many hotels, but the RIALTO HOTEL is by far my favourite choice... Great location (overlooking Rialto bridge), friendly and helpfull service, very good resturant and nice rooms. Great value for money... The quality is much better than the average 3* hotel. Definetely a recommendation for every traveller to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose another location if staying in Venice again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The communication before our stay was excellent and the front desk service good. We had requested a non-smoking room and had to make a room change upon our arrival. The room was adequate and clean but looking a little worn and in need of updating. The location is right in the heart of it with shopping and dining options aplenty. This proved to be a bit of a turn off after a while - we seemed to be hustled by street vendors, gondola operators, beggars and even restaurateurs at nearly every encounter. If we travel to Venice in the furture we'd prefer a location less tainted and overrun by tourists - the Castello neighborhood is much more quaint, genuine and less congested.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rialto Venezia
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 5149 | Riva del Ferro/Ponte di Rialto, 30124 Venice, Italy
